denixe: <entryFree id="n13092" type="main" key="de_nixe_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēnixē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, = enixe, q. v., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 11, 26</bibl> Brix.</entryFree>
denominatio: <entryFree id="n13093" type="main" key="de_no_mi^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēnōmĭnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>denomino</etym>, rhetor. t. t., <sense id="n13093.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the substitution of the name of an object for that of another to which it has some relation, as the name of the cause for that of the effect, of the property for that of the substance</hi>, etc.; <hi rend="ital">a metonymy</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 32</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:23 sq" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 23 sq.</bibl>, and immutatio.</sense></entryFree>
denominativus: <entryFree id="n13094" type="main" key="de_no_mi^na_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēnōmĭnātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n13094.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., pertaining to derivation, formed by derivation, derived</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 619</bibl></cit> P.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēnōmĭnātīvē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">by derivation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere aliquid,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 4, § 381</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
denomino: <entryFree id="n13095" type="main" key="de_no_mi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-nōmĭno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n13095.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to name, to designate specifically, to denominate</hi> (not ante-Aug.; most freq. in Quint.): hinc (sc. ab Lamo) Lamiae denominati, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 3, 17, 3</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:71" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa sunt et Graece et Latine non denominata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">etiam in iis, quae denominata sunt (opp. res plurimae carent appellationibus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 10, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de re denominata (opp. de communi appellatione),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 6, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:26:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 26, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:19:5" default="NO">3, 19, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
denormo: <entryFree id="n13096" type="main" key="de_normo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-normo</orth>, no <sense id="n13096.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>norma</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to disfigure, to make irregular</hi> or <hi rend="ital">crooked</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">angulus, qui nunc denormat agellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 9</bibl></cit>: linea denormata, Auct. de Lim. p. 252 Goes.</sense></entryFree>
denotatio: <entryFree id="n13097" type="main" key="de_no^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēnŏtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>denoto</etym>, <sense id="n13097.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a marking</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pointing out</hi> (late Lat.): omnium denotatione damnatus. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 19:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 19, 3</bibl>; Tert. Cult. fem. 13; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Sir. 5, 17</bibl>. <cb n="DENS" /></sense></entryFree>
denotatus: <entryFree id="n13098" type="hapax" key="de_no^ta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēnŏtātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n13098.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a marking</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pointing out;</hi> only denotatui, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 4 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
denoto: <entryFree id="n13099" type="main" key="de_no^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-nŏto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n13099.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to mark, set a mark on</hi>, with chalk, color, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">pedes venalium creta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 17, 58, § 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lineam conspicuo colore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:15" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 15</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n13099.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n13099.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To mark out, point out, specify, indicate, denote, designate</hi> (rare but class.—cf. demonstro): <cit><quote lang="la">qui uno nuntio atque una significatione litterarum civis Romanos necandos trucidandosque denotavit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud dubie Icilios denotante senatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 55</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13099.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To take note of, mark</hi> with the mind, <hi rend="ital">observe accurately</hi>, denotantibus vobis ora ac metum singulorum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum denotandis hominum palloribus sufficeret vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quot et quales sint nati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 9, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ei res similes occurrant, quas non habeat denotatas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 18, 57</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:70:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 70, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13099.4" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to stigmatize, scandalize, brand with reproach</hi> or <hi rend="ital">infamy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mollem et effeminatum omni probro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Cal. 56 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turpia legata, quae denotandi legatarii gratia scribuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:54" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 30, 54 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui gaudet iniquitate denotabitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Sir. 19, 5 sq.</bibl></cit>—Hence, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēnŏtātus</orth>, <hi rend="ital">marked out, conspicuous.—Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">denotatior ad contumeliae morsum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 1, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dens: <entryFree id="n13100" type="main" key="dens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dens</orth>, <itype>dentis</itype> (<sense id="n13100.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> usually dentium, but dentum is approved by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:38:67" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, 38, 67</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>root in Sanscr. dantas, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">o)dou/s</foreign>, Goth. tunthus, Germ. Zahn, and Engl. <hi rend="ital">tooth;</hi> cf. edo, Engl. eat</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a tooth.</hi> </sense><sense id="n13100.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: cui auro dentes juncti escunt, XII. Tab. 10, 9; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:160 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 61, § 160 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 54</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 11, 1, 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">primores,</quote> <trans><tr>the front teeth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 16, 15, § 68</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">also called adversi acuti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecisores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 11, 1, 52</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and in beasts: rapaces,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 6, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canini,</quote> <trans><tr>the canine teeth, eye-teeth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:7:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 7, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 61, § 160</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">in horses: columellares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:7:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 7, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 61, § 160</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">maxillares,</quote> <trans><tr>the jaw-teeth, grinders</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 1</bibl></cit>; called also genuini, Cic. l. l.; <cit><quote lang="la">and molares, Isid. l. l. et saep.: dentes scalpere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 4, 9, § 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fricare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scariphare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 11, 49, § 179</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 3, 8, § 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mobiles confirmare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 11, 49, § 178</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mobiles stabilire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 7, 26, § 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eximere,</quote> <trans><tr>to extract</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 9</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">evellere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 3, 8, § 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extrahere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 7, 26, § 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excutere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:16:10" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 16, 10</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">dens Indus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the elephant's</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:288" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 288</bibl></cit>; hence for <hi rend="ital">ivory</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:167" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 167</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">also called dens Libycus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:31:12" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 31, 12</bibl></cit> (3, 29, 12 M.): <cit><quote lang="la">Numida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:9:28" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 9, 28</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and Erythraeus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:100" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 100</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13100.2" n="2" level="3"> Prov. </sense><sense id="n13100.3" n="a" level="4"> Albis dentibus deridere aliquem, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to laugh heartily at a person</hi> (so as to show one's teeth), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 3, 48</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13100.4" n="b" level="4"> Venire sub dentem, <hi rend="ital">to fall into the jaws, under the clutches of</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 58, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13100.5" n="c" level="4"> Dentem pro dente, <hi rend="ital">tooth for tooth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:5:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 5, 38</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n13100.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> of things resembling a tooth, <hi rend="ital">a tooth, point, spike, prong, tine, fluke</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">aratri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:4:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 4, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:423 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 423 al.</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=135" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 135</bibl> Müll.: (irpicis) acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:9:68" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 9, 68</bibl>: (clavi) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:2:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 2, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">serrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 43, 83, § 227</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 5</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 246</bibl>, and 6, 58; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, in architecture, the walls indentated like the teeth of a saw, which connected the two main walls,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forcipis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 2</bibl></cit>: (ancorae) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 3</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for falx (vinitorum),</quote> <trans><tr>the pruning-hook</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:406" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 406</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n13100.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the tooth of envy, envy, ill-will</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">more hominum invident, in conviviis rodunt, in circulis vellicant: non illo inimico sed hoc maledico dente carpunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:chapter=26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 4, 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:6:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 6, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13100.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Of a destroying power</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">leti sub dentibus ipsis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:852" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 852</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of time: vitiataque dentibus aevi consumere omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:235" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 235</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and of water: aqua dentes habet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 42</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of malice: malignitatis dentes vitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 7</bibl></cit>, extr. 2.</sense></entryFree>
densabilis: <entryFree id="n13101" type="main" key="densa_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">densābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>denso</etym>, <sense id="n13101.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">binding, astringent</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">cibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:7" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vaporatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:3:3" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 3, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
densatio: <entryFree id="n13102" type="hapax" key="densa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">densātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n13102.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a thickening</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 7, 39, § 82</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
densativus: <entryFree id="n13103" type="main" key="densa_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">densātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n13103.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">binding, astringent</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">virtutis esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:37" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 37</bibl></cit>. <cb n="DENS" /></sense></entryFree>
dense: <entryFree id="n13104" type="main" key="dense_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">densē</orth>, <sense id="n13104.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv., thickly, frequently</hi>, etc. v. densus <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
denseletae: <entryFree id="n13105" type="main" key="Densele_tae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Denselētae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n13105.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tribe of Northern Thrace</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 11, 18, § 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:34:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 34, 84</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">the same called Dentheleti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:22" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
denseo: <entryFree id="n13106" type="main" key="denseo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">denseo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, v. denso.</entryFree>
densitas: <entryFree id="n13107" type="main" key="densi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">densĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>densus</etym>, <sense id="n13107.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">thickness, density</hi> (perh. not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n13107.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">limus spissatur et in densitatem coit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 15, 51, § 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">chartae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 13, 12, 24, § 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 2, § 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:9:18 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 9, 18 al.</bibl> —</sense><sense id="n13107.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">figurarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 2, 72</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
denso: <entryFree id="n13108" type="main" key="denso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">denso</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1, and</itype> (less freq.) <orth extent="full" lang="la">denseo</orth>, no <sense id="n13108.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, ētum, 2 (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 837</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 233</bibl> ib. The MSS. often confound the two forms; densare appears to be critically certain in Liv. and Quint.; densere <hi rend="ital">act.</hi> only denset, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:650" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 650</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">imp.</hi> densete, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 264</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">densebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:491" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 491</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">denserent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 14</bibl></cit>; also <hi rend="ital">active forms</hi>, Apul. Mund. p. 61, 13; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 5, 53 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:159" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 159</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">gerund, densendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:482" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 482</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">pass. inf. parag.</hi> denserier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:395" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 395</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:647" default="NO" valid="yes">647</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">densetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:369 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 369 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">densentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:28:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 1, 28, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:794" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 794</bibl>, and other forms in Verg.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Wagner,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:248" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 248</bibl></cit>.—See also addenso and condenso), <hi rend="ital">v. a., to make thick, to press together, thicken</hi> (not in Cic. and Caes.). </sense><sense id="n13108.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juppiter uvidus austris Densat, erant quae rara modo, et, quae densa, relaxat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:419" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 419</bibl></cit> (paraphrased: <cit><quote lang="la">densatus et laxatus aer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:9:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 9, 16</bibl></cit>); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rarum pectine denset opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:820" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 820</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:395" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 395</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:647" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 647</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:656" default="NO" valid="yes">656</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:662" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 662</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agmina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:794" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 794</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">catervas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 264</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scutis super capita densatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 9</bibl></cit>: funera, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:28:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 1, 28, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">glomerata corpus in unum densatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:605" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 605</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(nubes) largos in imbres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 76</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 41, 96, § 239</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">obtenta densantur nocte tenebrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 246</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:369" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 369</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hastilia,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>hurls thickly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:650" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 650</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">ictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">super acervum petrarum radices ejus densabuntur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job 8, 17</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(aestus) quasi densendo subtexit caerula nimbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:482" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 482</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13108.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> of speech, <hi rend="ital">to condense</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">instandum quibusdam in partibus et densanda oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:164" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 164</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">figuras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:101" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 3, 101</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
densus: <entryFree id="n13109" type="main" key="densus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">densus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>kindred with <foreign lang="greek">dasu/s, daulo/s</foreign> (i. e. <foreign lang="greek">dasulo/s</foreign>); cf. Lat. dumus, old form dusmus, and dumetum</etym>, <sense id="n13109.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">thick, dense</hi>, i. e. consisting of parts crowded together. opp. to rarus (on the contrary, crassus, <hi rend="ital">thick</hi>, is opp. to <hi rend="ital">thin, fluid</hi>; and spissus, <hi rend="ital">close, compact</hi>, with the predominant idea of impenetrability; cf. also: angustus, artus, solidus—class. and freq., esp. in poets and historians; in Cic. very rare). </sense><sense id="n13109.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n13109.2" n="1" level="3"> In space: <cit><quote lang="la">ne dum variantia rerum Tanta queat densis rarisque ex ignibus esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:654" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 654</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:419" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 419</bibl> (for which densatus et laxatus aër, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:9:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 9, 16</bibl>); and: <cit><quote lang="la">(terra) Rara sit an supra morem si densa requiras ... Densa magis Cereri, rarissima quaeque Lyaeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:227 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 227 sq.</bibl></cit>: densa et glutinosa terra, Col. praef. § 24: silva, poëta ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 15</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">densiores silvae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:29:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 29, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">densissimae silvae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 38, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucus densissimae opacitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 1:11:10" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 1, 11, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">denso corpore nubes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:361" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 361</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">denso agmine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 100</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">agmen (sc. navium),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:834" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 834</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">densum umeris vulgus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:13:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 2, 13, 32</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">tunicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 23, 27, § 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">zmaragdi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 5, 18, § 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litus,</quote> <trans><tr>sandy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:576" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 576</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:275" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 275</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequor,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>frozen</tr>.</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:640" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 640</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aër,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 2, 7, 14</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1 praef.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:269" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 269</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caligo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:466" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 466</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">densissima nox,</quote> <trans><tr>pitch-dark night</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 31</bibl></cit>: umbra, Catull. 65, 13; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 1, 7, 20</bibl> et saep.— <cit><quote lang="la">Without distinction, corresp. with crassus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:246 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 246 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n13109.3" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> with <hi rend="ital">abl., thickly set with, covered with, full of</hi>: loca silvestribus sepibus densa, poëta ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 42 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">specus virgis ac vimine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vallis piceis et acuta cupressu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:155" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 155</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thybris verticibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:502" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 6, 502</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ficus pomis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:253" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 253</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora setis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:846" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 13, 846</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 1, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">femina crinibus emptis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 165</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funale lampadibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 12, 247</bibl></cit>: trames <pb n="547" /> <cb n="DENT" /> caligine opaca (coupled with obscurus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 54</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n13109.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of the parts themselves which are crowded together, <hi rend="ital">thick, close, set close</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">superiorem partem collis densissimis castris (sc. trinis) compleverant,</quote> <trans><tr>pitched very near together</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:46:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 46, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sepes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frutices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ilex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:165" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 165</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:511" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 511</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ministri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> M. 2, 717</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">densior suboles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:308" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 308</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dens (pectinis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:9:68" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 9, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:14:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 14, 42</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">pilae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:348" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 348</bibl></cit> et saep.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">densorum turba malorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:6:41" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 6, 41</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13109.5" n="2" level="3"> In time, of things which take place in close succession, <hi rend="ital">thick, frequent, continuous</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">ictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:459" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 459</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">plagae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:5:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 3, 5, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aquilo,</quote> <trans><tr>strong, powerful</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 196</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silentia,</quote> <trans><tr>deep, profound</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:604" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 604</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:347" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 347</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pericula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:7:15" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:3:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ictus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 5, 31</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n13109.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> of speech, <hi rend="ital">condensed, concise</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox atrox in ira, et aspera ac densa,</quote> <trans><tr>coarse</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:63" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta vis in eo (sc. Demosthene) tam densa omnia, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:76" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 76</bibl></cit>; cf. transf. to the writer himself: densior ille (sc. Demosthenes), hic (sc. Cicero) copiosior, ib. § 106: densus et brevis et semper instans sibi Thucydides, ib. § 73: (Euripides) sententiis densus, ib. § 68.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">densē</orth> (very rare). </sense><sense id="n13109.7" n="1" level="3"> In space, <hi rend="ital">thickly, closely, close together</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caesae alni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 37, 67, § 173</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calcatum quam densissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 12 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites densius se commovebant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 24, 6, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13109.8" n="2" level="3"> (Acc. to <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> I. B. 2.) In time, <hi rend="ital">frequently, rapidly, one after the other</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod in perpetuitate dicendi eluceat aliquando, idem apud alios densius, apud alios fortasse rarius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:2:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla tamen subeunt mihi tempora densius istis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:9:11" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 9, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">replicatis quaestionibus dense,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
dentale: <entryFree id="n13110" type="main" key="denta_le"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dentāle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">dentālia</orth>, <itype>ium</itype> (only the <sense id="n13110.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">plural</hi> class.; <number>sing.</number> post-class.), <gen>n.</gen> <etym>dens, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> I. B.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">the share-beam</hi>, to which the vomer or ploughshare was attached. </sense><sense id="n13110.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 172</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:24" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2, 24</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus vomerum toto porrectum dentali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 18, 48, § 171</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n13110.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sulco terens dentalia,</quote> <trans><tr>a ploughshare</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:73" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 73</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dentaneus: <entryFree id="n13111" type="main" key="denta_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dentānĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n13111.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., threatening</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentanea (fulgura) quae speciem periculi sine periculo adferunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:N. Q. 2:49:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> N. Q. 2, 49, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
dentarius: <entryFree id="n13112" type="main" key="denta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dentārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>dens</etym>, <sense id="n13112.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to the teeth</hi> (in the later medic. lang.): herba, i. e. <hi rend="ital">that cures the toothache</hi>, Ap. Herb. 4, 8, 66.</sense></entryFree>
dentarpaga: <entryFree id="n13113" type="greek" key="dentarpa^ga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dentarpăga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vox hibr. from dens and <foreign lang="greek">a(/rpac</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n13113.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an instrument for drawing teeth</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 99, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dentatus: <entryFree id="n13114" type="main" key="denta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dentātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>dens</etym>. <sense id="n13114.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Toothed, having teeth</hi>. </sense><sense id="n13114.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quosdam et cum dentibus nasci, sicut M. Curium, qui ob id Dentatus cognominatus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 16, 15, § 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">male dentata (puella),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 339</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:73" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 73</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13114.2" n="2" level="3"> Pregn.: <cit><quote lang="la">bestiae,</quote> <trans><tr>the wild beasts used in the public combats</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 10, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">19, 6, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2533</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">facete, vir (i. e. mordax),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 4, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13114.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> (acc. to dens, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> I. B.), <hi rend="ital">toothed, dentated, spiked, pointed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rastri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=136" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 136</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">crates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 18, 48, § 173</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 22, 48, § 167</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:432" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 432</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n13114.4" n="II" level="1"> Charta, <hi rend="ital">polished with a tooth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:15:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 15, 6</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 12, 25, § 81</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
denter: <entryFree id="n13115" type="main" key="Denter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Denter</orth>, <itype>tris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n13115.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the surname of M. Livius</hi> (consul 452 A. U. C.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 1</bibl> and 9.</sense></entryFree>
denthelethi: <entryFree id="n13116" type="main" key="Denthe_le_thi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Denthēlēthi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <foreign lang="greek">*danqhlh=tai</foreign>, = Denseletae q. v., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:53:12 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 53, 12 al.</bibl></entryFree>
dentheliathes: <entryFree id="n13117" type="main" key="Dentheli^a^the_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Denthelĭăthēs</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym><foreign lang="greek">*denqa/lioi</foreign>, a city of the Peloponnesus</etym>, <sense id="n13117.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Denthelian, belonging to Denthalii</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 43</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
denticulatus: <entryFree id="n13118" type="main" key="denti^cu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dentĭcŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>denticulus</etym>, <sense id="n13118.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">furnished with small teeth, denticulated</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">falces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:20:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 20, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forfices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 31, 51, § 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conchae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 33, 52, § 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">olus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 15, 93, § 164</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
denticulus: <entryFree id="n13119" type="main" key="denti^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dentĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>dens</etym>, <sense id="n13119.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little tooth</hi> (not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n13119.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 28, 6</bibl>; Ap. Mag. p. 278, 9.—</sense><sense id="n13119.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n13119.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An agricultural implement with teeth</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Jun. 2, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13119.4" n="B" level="2"> In archit., <hi rend="ital">a modillion</hi>, <cb n="DENU" /> <hi rend="ital">dental</hi>, a small ornament between the frieze and the larmier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dentiducum: <entryFree id="n13120" type="hapax" key="denti^du_cum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dentĭdūcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. instrumentum) [dens-duco], <sense id="n13120.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an instrument for drawing teeth</hi>, as transl. of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">o)dontagwgo/n</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:4" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> (in Varro, dentarpaga q. v.).</sense></entryFree>
dentifrangibulus: <entryFree id="n13121" type="main" key="denti^frangi^bu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dentĭfrangĭbŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">-um</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>dens-frango</etym>, <sense id="n13121.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tooth-breaker</hi>, a comic word in Plautus. * </sense><sense id="n13121.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Masc., one who knocks out teeth</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Bac. 4, 2, 23</bibl>.— * </sense><sense id="n13121.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">N. pl.</hi> (sc. instrumenta), <hi rend="ital">the fist</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dentifricium: <entryFree id="n13122" type="main" key="denti^fri^ci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dentĭfrĭcĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>dens - frico</etym>, <sense id="n13122.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">tooth-powder, dentifrice</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:178 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 11, 49, § 178 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:46 al" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 3, 11, § 46 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 59" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 59</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
dentilegus: <entryFree id="n13123" type="hapax" key="denti^le^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dentĭlĕgus</orth>, i. <gen>m.</gen> <etym>dens-lego</etym>, <sense id="n13123.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who picks up his teeth</hi>, sc. after they have been knocked out; <hi rend="ital">a tooth-gatherer</hi>, a comic word: <cit><quote lang="la">dentilegos omnis mortalis faciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dentio: <entryFree id="n13124" type="main" key="denti^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dentĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>dens</etym>, <sense id="n13124.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to get</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cut teeth, to teeth</hi>. </sense><sense id="n13124.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">propria dentientium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pueros tarde dentientis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 3, 8, § 22</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:140 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 20, 83, § 140 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">auribus perhauriunda haec sunt, ne dentes dentiant (the words of a parasite who fears to have nothing for his teeth to chew upon),</quote> <trans><tr>lest the teeth grow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 34</bibl></cit> Lorenz ad loc.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n13125" type="hapax" key="denti^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dentĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. dentio</etym>, <sense id="n13125.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a teething, dentition</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 1, 4, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dentiscalpium: <entryFree id="n13126" type="main" key="dentiscalpi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dentiscalpĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>dens-scalpo</etym>, <sense id="n13126.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tooth-pick</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:53" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:22" default="NO">14, 22</bibl> <hi rend="ital">in lemm</hi>.</sense></entryFree>
dentitio: <entryFree id="n13127" type="main" key="denti_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dentītĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. dentio</etym>, <sense id="n13127.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a teething, dentition</hi>, of children, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:257 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 19, 78, § 257 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:135" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 15, 47, § 135</bibl> sq. al.; Veg. a. v. 3, 25, 1.</sense></entryFree>
dentix: <entryFree id="n13128" type="main" key="dentix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dentix</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">dentrix</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 12, 6, 23</bibl>), <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>dens</etym>, <sense id="n13128.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sort of sea-fish; plur.</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:16:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 16, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
denubo: <entryFree id="n13129" type="main" key="de_nu_bo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-nūbo</orth>, <itype>psi, ptum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n13129.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to marry off</hi> (sc. from the paternal home; cf. deduco), <hi rend="ital">to marry</hi> (rare; perhaps not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n13129.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec Caenis in ullos Denupsit thalamos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 196</bibl></cit>; Ap. M. 9, p. 231, 29; <cit><quote lang="la">5, p. 166, 6: Claro fratri denupta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mag. p. 319, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13129.2" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">To demean one's self by marriage, to marry beneath one's rank</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Julia denupsit in domum Rubellii Blandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 27</bibl></cit> (33).—</sense><sense id="n13129.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: plantis, Col. poët. 10, 158.—</sense><sense id="n13129.4" n="2" level="3"> Obscene, of a mock marriage, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:29" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
denudatio: <entryFree id="n13130" type="main" key="de_nu_da_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-nūdātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n13130.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a laying bare, uncovering</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Sir. 11</bibl>. 29. From</sense></entryFree>
denudo: <entryFree id="n13131" type="main" key="de_nu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-nūdo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n13131.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to lay bare, make naked, denude</hi>. </sense><sense id="n13131.1" n="I" level="1"> i. q., nudo, <hi rend="ital">to uncover</hi> (rare but class.). </sense><sense id="n13131.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: denudatis ossibus, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:44:106" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 44, 106</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne Verres denudetur a pectore, ne cicatrices populus Romanus aspiciat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capita cum superciliis denudanda tonsori praebuimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 103, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matresfamilias et adultas aetate virgines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:69" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(surculi) medullam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:41:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 41, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">femur virginis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judith, 9, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n13131.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to disclose, reveal, detect, betray, expose</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">denudavit mihi suum consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 38</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa incidunt quae invitos denudent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 15" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcana amici,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Sir. 27, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13131.4" n="II" level="1"> i. q., spolio, <hi rend="ital">to strip, plunder</hi>. * </sense><sense id="n13131.5" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: civibus Romanis crudelissime denudatis ac divenditis, Lentul. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 15</bibl>.— * </sense><sense id="n13131.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne dum novo et alieno ornatu velis ornare juris civilis scientiam, suo quoque eam concesso et tradito spolies atque denudes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:55:235" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 55, 235</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
denuntiatio: <entryFree id="n13132" type="main" key="de_nunti^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēnuntĭātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-ciatio</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>denuntio</etym>, <sense id="n13132.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an indication, intimation, announcement, declaration</hi>. </sense><sense id="n13132.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen. obj.</hi> = significatio: <cit><quote lang="la">quae est enim ista a deis profecta significatio et quasi denuntiatio calamitatum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:25:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 25, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 6, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">armorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testimonii,</quote> <trans><tr>threatening to summon as a witness</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 6, 14</bibl></cit>; cf. denuntio, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> I.: denuntiatione periculi permovere aliquem, <hi rend="ital">by a menacing</hi>, *<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingentis terroris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 36</bibl></cit>: accusatorum, i. e. <hi rend="ital">information, an informing</hi>, = delatio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:66" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 66</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen. subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Catilinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:18:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 18, 52</bibl></cit>: boni civis (i. e. professio, promissio), Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 8, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quietis,</quote> <trans><tr>warning in a dream</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:70:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 70, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13132.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: huic <cb n="DENU" /> denuntiationi ille pareat? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 6, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:55 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 55 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
denuntiativus: <entryFree id="n13133" type="main" key="de_nunti^a_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēnuntĭātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n13133.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">monitory, indicatory</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:4:67" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 4, 67</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
denuntiator: <entryFree id="n13134" type="gloss" key="de_nunti^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēnuntĭātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>denuntio</etym>, under the emperors (since the second century of the Christian era), <sense id="n13134.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a police officer, police inspector</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2544</bibl> and 3216.</sense></entryFree>
denuntio: <entryFree id="n13135" type="main" key="de_nunti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-nuntĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-cĭo</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> Orig. t. t. in the lang. of pub. law, relig., and jurispr., <sense id="n13135.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to give an official intimation, to make an official announcement</hi> or <hi rend="ital">declaration of one's intentions</hi> (by means of a messenger, herald, etc.); <hi rend="ital">to announce, intimate, declare</hi>, = nuntiando declarare; and with a foll. <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> or merely the subjunctive, <hi rend="ital">to intimate, order, command</hi> (for syn. cf.: edico, indico, narro, nuntio, refero, defero, renuntio, enuntio, dico). </sense><sense id="n13135.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. </sense><sense id="n13135.2" n="A" level="2"> Polit. lang. </sense><sense id="n13135.3" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut omne bellum, quod denuntiatum indictumque non esset, id injustum esse atque impium judicaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 17</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with indictum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 23</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> (Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 18, 1, 3</bibl>); <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 11, 36</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quos senatus ad denuntiandum bellum miserat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrum paucorum ea denuntiata an universae civitatis essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 37 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n13135.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod sibi Caesar denuntiaret, se Aeduorum injurias non neglecturum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:36:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 36, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum se scire quae fierent denuntiaret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> et saep. —And with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> alone: <cit><quote lang="la">denuntiat centurionibus exsequi caedem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 37</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n13135.5" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: Gaditanos denuntiavisse Gallonio, ut sua sponte excederet Gadibus; <cit><quote lang="la">si id non fecisset, sibi consilium capturos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 20, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nationibus denuntiare, uti auxilia mittant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">per vicos urbesque, ut commeatus expedirent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul denuntiavit ut essent animi parati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 86 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dictator magistro equitum denuntiavit, ut sese loco teneret, neu, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 30</bibl></cit>; and so with <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 36 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 4, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13135.6" n="(d)" level="5"> With simp. subj.: <cit><quote lang="la">(legati) denuntient Gallicis populis, multitudinem suam domi contineant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 54 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:55" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Alcibiades) denuntiavit his (militibus), qui in stationibus erant, observarent lumen, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 3:12:1 al" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 3, 12, 1 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n13135.7" n="B" level="2"> In relig. lang. </sense><sense id="n13135.8" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus portentis magna populo Romano bella denuntiabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:43:97" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 43, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caedem Caesari evidentibus prodigiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:81" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 81 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:94" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 94</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:366 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 366 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n13135.9" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid tale acciderit, ut a deo denuntiatum videatur, ut exeamus e vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:49:118" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 49, 118</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13135.10" n="C" level="2"> In jurid. lang. </sense><sense id="n13135.11" n="(a)" level="5"> Alicui testimonium, <hi rend="ital">to summon a witness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si accusator voluerit testimonium eis denuntiare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:38:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 38, 110</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">denuntiatio testimonii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 6, 14</bibl></cit>); so, <cit><quote lang="la">testibus: quoniam duo genera sunt testium, aut voluntariorum aut eorum, quibus in judiciis publicis lege denuntiatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 7, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. ib. § 15; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 5, 2</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">non denuntiavi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 15, 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13135.12" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To give notice of a suit</hi> or <hi rend="ital">process</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:3:20:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 5, 3, 20, § 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de isto fundo, Cic. Caecin., 32, 95: in foro denuntiat fundum illum suum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:ib. 7:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13135.13" n="(g)" level="5"> Litem denuntiare, <hi rend="ital">to summon for immediate trial</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 10:52" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 10, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 16:11" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 16, 11</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n13135.14" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> beyond the technical sphere, <hi rend="ital">to announce, intimate, declare; to denounce, menace, threaten;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, or merely the subjunct., <hi rend="ital">to intimate, order, command</hi>. —</sense><sense id="n13135.15" n="A" level="2"> Of personal subjects. </sense><sense id="n13135.16" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille inimicitias mihi denuntiavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 7, 19</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">populo Romano servitutem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 8, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proscriptionem, caedem, direptionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:20:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 20, 46</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 17</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">oculis et aspectu vim tribuniciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 5, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 12, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13135.17" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sex. Alfenus denuntiat, sese procuratorem esse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 6, 27</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 6, 3</bibl> (with testificor and ante praedico): <cit><quote lang="la">cum se ad omnia, de quibus quisque audire vellet esse paratum denuntiaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:22:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 22, 103</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n13135.18" n="(g)" level="5"> With a <hi rend="ital">relative clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">denuntiasti homo adulescens, quid de summa reipublicae sentires,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13135.19" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: mihi Lupus noster subito denuntiavit, ut ad to <pb n="548" /> <cb n="DEOR" /> scriberem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 25</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">simple subjunctive</hi>, = moneo, praedico, ante denuntio, abstineant, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:chapter=12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de isto fundo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:chapter=32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 32 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—（<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">monente et denuntiante te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 17</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n13135.20" n="B" level="2"> Of subjects not personal, <hi rend="ital">to give notice, make known, signify, indicate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra continens adventus hostium multis indiciis ante denuntiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa arma non periculum nobis sed praesidium denuntiant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ante exortum nubes globabuntur, hiemem asperam denuntiabunt, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:344" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 35, 78, § 344</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeruleus (color) pluviam denuntiat, igneus euros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:453" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 453</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc juncti boves, hoc paratus equus, hoc data arma denuntiant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbor statim pestem denuntians,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 22, 38, § 118</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
denuo: <entryFree id="n13136" type="main" key="de_nu^o_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēnŭō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>contr. from dē nŏvo, which never occurs; v. Ruhnk. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:prol. 26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. prol. 26</bibl>; Oud. <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 225</bibl>.; cf.: Fr. <hi rend="ital">de nouveau</hi></etym>, <sense id="n13136.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">anew, afresh, again</hi> (most freq. in Plaut. and Ter.; elsewh. rare; not in Caes. or the Aug. poets—for syn. cf.: iterum, rursus, ab integro). </sense><sense id="n13136.1" n="I" level="1"> Of the restoration of a thing which has been destroyed, = de integro, <hi rend="ital">anew, afresh</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">e)k kainh=s</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedificantur aedes totae denuo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 2, 36</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">urbes terrae motu subversas denuo condidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:47" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oportet vos nasci denuo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,004:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Joan. 3, 7</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n13136.2" n="II" level="1"> For iterum, <hi rend="ital">a second time, once more, again</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si parum intellexti, dicam denuo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 59</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 3, 66</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam ego tibi Persam adducam denuo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 5, 2, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Etruria rebellante denuo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">denuo in voluntarium exsilium proficiscitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 5, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> —</sense><sense id="n13136.3" n="III" level="1"> For rursus, of any thing that is repeated (not precisely a second time), <hi rend="ital">once more, again;</hi> hence often with verbs compounded with <hi rend="ital">re</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecce Apollo denuo, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 2, 115</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">So</hi>. Amphitruonis ego sum servus Sosia. <hi rend="ital">Me.</hi> Etiam denuo? <hi rend="ital">what, again?</hi> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Amph. 1, 1, 238</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 1, 139</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 2, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sicilia censa denuo est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recita denuo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 14</bibl></cit>.—Pleonast. with redire, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 51</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 42</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">with redauspicari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 5, 109</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">with respondere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 24</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">with referre, id. Hec. prol. alt. 30. And sometimes with rursus (rursum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. prol. 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. prol. 79</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n13136.4" n="IV" level="1"> Like our <hi rend="ital">again</hi> (in, I am going back again), Gr. <foreign lang="greek">au\=</foreign>, where an action is reversed (mostly colloquial): <cit><quote lang="la">aperi ... continuo operito denuo,</quote> <trans><tr>and then cover it up again</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:3:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 3, 76</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 6, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et nunc quid exspectat, Syre? an dum hinc denuo abeat, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fiet tibi puniceum corium postea atrum denuo,</quote> <trans><tr>and then again back</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">chlamydem sumam denuo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 79</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 19, 26</bibl>; cf. Hand Turs. II. p. 278-280.</sense></entryFree>
deocco: <entryFree id="n13137" type="hapax" key="de^occo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕ-occo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n13137.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to harrow in</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 15, 37, § 137</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
deois: <entryFree id="n13138" type="main" key="De_o_i_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dēōīs</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*dhwi+/s</foreign>, <sense id="n13138.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the daughter of Deo</hi> (<foreign lang="greek">*dhw/</foreign>, Ceres), i. e. <hi rend="ital">Proserpine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 114</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 4, 50</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
