deoius: <entryFree id="n13139" type="main" key="De_o_i^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dēōĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n13139.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., belonging</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sacred to Deo</hi> (<foreign lang="greek">*dhw/</foreign>, Ceres): <cit><quote lang="la">quercus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:761" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 761</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
deonero: <entryFree id="n13140" type="main" key="de^o^ne^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕ-ŏnĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n13140.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to unload, disburden</hi> (very rare). </sense><sense id="n13140.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">machinae deoneratae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 24, 6, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, p. 202</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13140.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: ex illius invidia deonerare aliquid et in te traicere, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:14:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 14, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">foeditate corpora deonerans,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, p. 249</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 58, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
deoperio: <entryFree id="n13141" type="main" key="de^o^pe^rio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕ-ŏpĕrio</orth>, <itype>ui, rtum, 4</itype>, <sense id="n13141.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to uncover, disclose</hi> (late Lat.), Ambros. de Excid. Fr. sui Sat. 2, 80.</sense></entryFree>
deopto: <entryFree id="n13142" type="main" key="de^opto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕ-opto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n13142.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to choose out, select</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deoptandi potestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 191" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 191</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
deorata: <entryFree id="n13143" type="gloss" key="de^orata"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕorata</orth> <itype>perorata</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=74:10" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 74, 10</bibl>.</entryFree>
deorsum: <entryFree id="n13144" type="main" key="de^orsum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕorsum</orth> (dissyll. <sense id="n13144.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">per synaeresin</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:362" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 362</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:205 al" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 205 al.</bibl>; cf.<cit><quote lang="la">, on the contrary, trisyll.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 202</bibl></cit>.—Also <orth extent="full" lang="la">deorsus</orth>, <itype>like prorsus, quorsus, rursus, adversus</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:25:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 25, 69</bibl>; Ap. M. 8, p. 207, 18; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9</bibl>, p. 236, 40; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 47, 35</bibl>; id. Flor. <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 15), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>contr. from devorsum, turned down</etym>, <hi rend="ital">downwards</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">ka/tw</foreign>, opp. to sursum (class.). </sense><sense id="n13144.1" n="I" level="1"> To indicate motion: ego me deorsum duco de arbore,<cb n="DEPA" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 8, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deorsum cuncta feruntur (opp. flammae expressae sursum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 202</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:205" default="NO" valid="yes">205</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:335" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 335</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:25:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 25, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:6:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 6, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 26, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliqui (gestus) ante nos et dextra laevaque et sursum et deorsum aliquid ostendunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:105" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deorsum cadit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 89</bibl></cit>; cf.: ut isto gladio deorsus ad meum Tlepolemum viam quaeram, i. e. in orcum, Ap. M. 8, p. 207, 18.—</sense><sense id="n13144.2" n="b" level="4"> Pleonast. with versus (versum): <cit><quote lang="la">ubi deorsum versus ibit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:156:4" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 156, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:7:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 7, 5</bibl>; Quadrig. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:1:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi eo veneris, clivos deorsum vorsum est,</quote> <trans><tr>right down before you</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 2, 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13144.3" n="c" level="4"> With sursum, <hi rend="ital">up and down</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">a)/nw ka/tw</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne sursum deorsum cursites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 47</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">naturis sursum deorsum, ultro citro commeantibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:33:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 33, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si sanguis sursum deorsumve erupit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum terra quatitur et sursum ac deorsum movetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:21" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13144.4" n="II" level="1"> To indicate position, locality, <hi rend="ital">down, below</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui colunt deorsum, magis aestate laborant: qui sursum, magis hieme ... nec non sursum quam deorsum tardius seruntur ac metuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:6:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 6, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 7, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:2:34 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 2, 34 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:4:39 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 4, 39 al.</bibl>—Cf. on this art. Hand, Turs. II. p. 280- 282.</sense></entryFree>
deorsus: <entryFree id="n13145" type="main" key="de^orsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕorsus</orth>, v. preced. <sense id="n13145.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
deosculor: <entryFree id="n13146" type="main" key="de^oscu^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕ-oscŭlor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n13146.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a., to kiss warmly, affectionately</hi> (very rare). </sense><sense id="n13146.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">vix reprimo labra, Ob istam rem quin te deosculer, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:8:17 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 8, 17 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Casinam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuos oculos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scipionis dexteram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:10:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 10, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,031:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cant. 8, 1</bibl>.— * </sense><sense id="n13146.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to praise, laud highly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem atque ingenium pueri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:23:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 23, 13</bibl></cit>.!*? Deosculatus in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> sense: rursum me deosculato, Ap. M. 2, p. 119; 121.</sense></entryFree>
depaciscor: <entryFree id="n13147" type="main" key="de_pa^ciscor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-păciscor</orth>, v. <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēpĕciscor</orth>.</entryFree>
depactus: <entryFree id="n13148" type="main" key="de_pactus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēpactus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um. <sense id="n13148.0" n="1" level="3"> <mood>Part.</mood>, from depaciscor.—</sense><sense id="n13148.1" n="2" level="3"> <mood>Part.</mood>, from depango.</sense></entryFree>
depalatio: <entryFree id="n13149" type="main" key="de_pa_la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēpālātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. depalo</etym>. <sense id="n13149.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A bounding with palings, a paling off</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3689</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13149.1" n="II" level="1"> Dierum, <hi rend="ital">a marking of hours by the shadows of small uprights on a dial</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 7, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
depalator: <entryFree id="n13150" type="main" key="de_pa_la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēpālātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n13150.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who marks out the bounds;</hi> hence, trop., <hi rend="ital">a founder</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">disciplinae divinae (coupled with architectus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 5, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
depalmo: <entryFree id="n13151" type="hapax" key="de_palmo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-palmo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>palma</etym>, <sense id="n13151.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to strike with the open hand, to box on the ear</hi>, Labeo ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
depalo: <entryFree id="n13152" type="main" key="de_pa_lo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-pālo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n13152.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to mark off</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bound with palings</hi> (late Lat.). </sense><sense id="n13152.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">jugera agri..ita uti depalatum est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3688</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13152.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to found, establish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quodammodo mundum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Herm. 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Apol. 10</bibl></cit>; cf. depalator.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n13153" type="main" key="de_pa^lo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-pălo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>palam</etym>, <sense id="n13153.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to disclose, reveal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulterium Veneris (Sol),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 2, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
depango: <entryFree id="n13154" type="main" key="de_pango"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-pango</orth>, no <sense id="n13154.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, pactum, 3, <hi rend="ital">v. a., to drive down, drive in, fix into the ground</hi> (rare). </sense><sense id="n13154.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">malleolum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:16:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 16, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:21:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 21, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 26, 46, § 110</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quercus et olea in scrobe depactae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 1, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in terram depacta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 96, 98, § 211</bibl></cit>. —* </sense><sense id="n13154.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae depactus terminus alte tam manet, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1087" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1087</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
deparcus: <entryFree id="n13155" type="hapax" key="de_parcus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-parcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n13155.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., excessively sparing, niggardly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sordidos ac deparcos esse (putabat),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
depasco: <entryFree id="n13156" type="main" key="de_pasco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-pasco</orth>, <itype>pāvi, pastum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-pascor</orth>, <itype>ci, 3</itype>, <sense id="n13156.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. depon., to feed down, feed off</hi>. </sense><sense id="n13156.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n13156.2" n="A" level="2"> Of the shepherd: <cit><quote lang="la">si d. saepius voles, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10:31" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 10, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">glandem immisso pecore depasco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10:4:9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 10, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saltus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:283" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 283</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luxuriem segetum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 112</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13156.3" n="B" level="2"> Of the cattle, <hi rend="ital">to feed upon, eat up, consume</hi>. </sense><sense id="n13156.4" n="(a)" level="5"> Form <hi rend="ital">depasco</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si haedi roscidas herbas depaverint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:5:21" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 5, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:539" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 539</bibl>.—In the <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepes Hyblaeis apibus florem depasta salicti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 1, 55</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">segetes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 17, 45, § 161</bibl></cit>: altaria, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">that which is upon it</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 93</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13156.5" n="(b)" level="5"> Form <hi rend="ital">depascor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">papilio ceras depascitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 19, 21, § 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miseros morsu depascitur artus (serpens),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 215</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:22:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 22, 5</bibl>.—In the <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> VI. Cons. Honor. 239</bibl>; cf.: depastis juvencis, Auct. <cb n="DEPE" /> Laud. Herc. 77.—</sense><sense id="n13156.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n13156.7" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Depon</hi>. </sense><sense id="n13156.8" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To cull, select</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia nos itidem depascimur aurea dicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13156.9" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To prune away, remove</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in summa ubertate (orationis) inest luxuries quaedam, quae stilo depascenda est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:23:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 23, 96</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n13156.10" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To destroy, waste</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">veterem possessionem Academiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:21:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 21, 55</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of disease: artus depascitur arida febris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:458" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 458</bibl></cit>; imitated by <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Rufin. 1, 302</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Idyll. 3, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13156.11" n="B" level="2"> Rarely in the <hi rend="ital">act.</hi> form: <cit><quote lang="la">et potuit Latium longo depascere bello?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:681" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 681</bibl></cit>: in inferno positi sunt; <cit><quote lang="la">mors depascet eos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:48:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 48, 14</bibl></cit> (cf. carpo, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II. B. 2: decerpo, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II. B. 2 al.).—The <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi> in a <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> signif.: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsaque diris Frons depasta modis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:51" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">depasti flammis scopuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:153" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 153</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
depascor: <entryFree id="n13157" type="main" key="de_pascor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēpascor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, v. depasco.</entryFree>
depastio: <entryFree id="n13158" type="hapax" key="de_pasti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēpastĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>depasco</etym>, <sense id="n13158.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a feeding</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animalium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:237" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 24, 37, § 237</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
depavitus: <entryFree id="n13159" type="hapax" key="de_pa^vi_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-păvītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [pavio], <sense id="n13159.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">beaten down, trampled down</hi>, trop., <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
depeciscor: <entryFree id="n13160" type="main" key="de_pe^ciscor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēpĕciscor</orth>, -pectus, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēpăciscor</orth>, <itype>pactus, 3</itype>, <sense id="n13160.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> [de-paciscor], <hi rend="ital">to bargain for, agree upon;</hi> and <hi rend="ital">absol., to make an agreement</hi>. </sense><sense id="n13160.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (repeatedly in Cic., elsewh. rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ipse tria praedia sibi depectus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 39 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum illo partem suam depecisci,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 38, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 38, 110</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">depectus est cum eis, ut arma et impedimenta relinqueret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:24:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 24, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad condiciones alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n13160.2" n="B" level="2"> With jurists, in a bad sense, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:6:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 6, 3</bibl>: hoc edicto tenetur etiam is, qui depectus est. Depectus autem dicitur turpiter pactus.—* </sense><sense id="n13160.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">abl. rei</hi>: jam depecisci morte cupio, <hi rend="ital">to bargain for death</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">I am content to die</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 1, 3, 14</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cur non honestissimo (sc. periculo) depecisci velim?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 7, 3</bibl></cit>, v. paciscor, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II.</sense></entryFree>
depectio: <entryFree id="n13161" type="main" key="de_pecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēpectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>depeciscor</etym>, <sense id="n13161.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bargain, contract, agreement</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Theod.</author> 2, 10, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
depecto: <entryFree id="n13162" type="main" key="de_pecto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-pecto</orth>, no <sense id="n13162.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, xum, ĕre, <hi rend="ital">v. a., to comb off, comb down, to comb</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">crines buxo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:229" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 229</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">jubas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:630" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 630</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Liber depexus crinibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:465" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 465</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars depectendi digerendique lini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 1, 3, § 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vellera foliis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 121</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 14, 32, § 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:54" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 17, 20, § 54</bibl>.— Jocosely, i. q. <hi rend="ital">to curry one's hide</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">give him a beating</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 78</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fusti pectito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 116</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
depectus: <entryFree id="n13163" type="main" key="de_pectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēpectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. <orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-paciscor</orth>.</entryFree>
depeculator: <entryFree id="n13164" type="main" key="de_pe^cu_la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēpĕcūlātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>depeculor</etym>, <sense id="n13164.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plunderer, embezzler</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aerarii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:27:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 27, 106</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:40:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 40, 96</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
depeculatus: <entryFree id="n13165" type="gloss" key="de_pe^cu_la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēpĕcūlātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (depeculor], <sense id="n13165.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plundering</hi>: depeculatus a pecore dicitur. Qui enim populum fraudat, peculatus poena tenetur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=75:11" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 75, 11</bibl> Müll.: depeculatu (<case>dat.</case>) me meis esse habitum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 83</bibl> Jacob. (dub. al. depeculatum).</sense></entryFree>
depeculor: <entryFree id="n13166" type="main" key="de_pe^cu_lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-pĕcūlor</orth>, <itype>ātus</itype> (and old <sense id="n13166.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Act. fut. infin.</hi> depeculassere, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 97, 9</bibl>; cf. Neue, Form. 2, 421, and <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>), 1, <hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> [peculium], <hi rend="ital">to despoil, pillage, rifle, plunder, embezzle</hi> (very rare). </sense><sense id="n13166.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">Apollonium omni argento spoliasti ac depeculatus es,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13166.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudem honoremque alicujus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to detract from, diminish</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 36</bibl></cit>.!*? In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> signif.: ubi senatus intellexit populum depeculari (<foreign lang="greek">a)posulou=sqai</foreign>), Cael. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 793</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">me impune irrisum esse habitum, depeculatum eis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 83</bibl></cit> (dub. v. depeculatus).</sense></entryFree>
depello: <entryFree id="n13167" type="main" key="de_pello"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-pello</orth>, <itype>pŭli, pulsum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n13167.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to drive out, drive away, remove, expel; to drive, thrust</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">cast down</hi> (class. and very freq.). </sense><sense id="n13167.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n13167.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">demoveri et depelli de loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:17:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 17, 49</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">anseres de Falerno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum de provincia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Cat. 2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cat. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquam de agro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:155" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 155</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab aris et focis ferrum flammamque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 42</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tantam molem a cervicibus nostris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jugum a civibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vincula a singulis vobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 18 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit> al.: <cit><quote lang="la">non equitem dorso, non frenum depulit ore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui recta via depulsus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 17, 29</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">recto cursu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem urbe,</quote> <trans><tr>to banish</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 24</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem Italia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 50</bibl></cit>; 16, <pb n="549" /> <cb n="DEPE" /> 33: <cit><quote lang="la">nubila caelo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:2:49" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 2, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignem classibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:727" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 727</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 9, 78</bibl>, and 109: <cit><quote lang="la">tela,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 2, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nobis aerata tela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:10:25" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 10, 25</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and ictus alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:652" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 652</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stellas Aurora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 100</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">noctem Aurorae lumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:835" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 835</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum cibo et potione fames sitisque depulsa est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:11:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 11, 37</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">frigus duramque famem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 17</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pestem augurio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:328" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 328</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortem fratri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:14:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 14, 130</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">quo (sc. Mantuam) solemus ovium teneros depellere fetus,</quote> <trans><tr>to drive down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 22</bibl></cit>: cognoscere, corpora se spatio depellere paulum, <hi rend="ital">push</hi> or <hi rend="ital">repel one another</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 219</bibl> Munro ad loc. (Lachm. ex conj. decellere).—</sense><sense id="n13167.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n13167.4" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="dom">Milit. t. t.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to drive away, expel, dislodge</hi> an enemy from his position: <cit><quote lang="la">defensores vallo munitionibusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 25</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">hostem loco,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totā Siciliā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,020:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Timol. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inde vi depelli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 58:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 58, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 2:5:17" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 2, 5, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidia ex his regionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidium facile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 1:10:3" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 1, 10, 3</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n13167.5" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> beyond the milit. sphere, <hi rend="ital">to thrust out, remove</hi> from a situation: <cit><quote lang="la">afflicti jam et depulsi loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 44</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">iterum ab eodem (sc. Themistocle) gradu depulsus est,</quote> <trans><tr>driven from his position</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13167.6" n="2" level="3"> Econom. t. t., a matre, a mamma, or <hi rend="ital">absol., to remove from the breast, to wean</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2:17" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:2:4:16" default="NO">2, 4, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:6:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 6, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 82</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 187</bibl>.—Of human beings, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 44</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n13167.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to deter, divert, dissuade from</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem de suscepta causa propositaque sententia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:chapter=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Lig. 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 7</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which, aliquem sententiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:6:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 6, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem de spe conatuque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:7:section=14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 7, § 14</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which, aliquem spe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:25:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 25, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:23:13" default="NO" valid="yes">41, 23, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">te ex illa crudeli actione meo consilio esse depulsum, Cic. Rab. perd. 5, 17: Caesar ab superioribus consiliis depulsus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 73</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">a qua re depulsus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 7, 3</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">judicem a veritate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5</bibl></cit> prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">1 et saep.: nec tuis depellor dictis quin rumori serviam,</quote> <trans><tr>to be deterred</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Vibidiam depellere nequivit, quin, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>to prevent, hinder</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 34</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13167.8" n="2" level="3"> With things as objects, <hi rend="ital">to remove, turn away, divert</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">servitutem depellere civitati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> post Red. in Sen. 8, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui turpitudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:32:77" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 32, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morte voluntaria turpitudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duobus hujus urbis terroribus depulsis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:47:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 47, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pericula amici,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cluent. 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multam praedibus ipsique T. Mario,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 20, 4</bibl></cit>: mortem fratri. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:14:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 14, 130</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes molestias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auditiones falsas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curas vino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:5:37" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 5, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostenta a semet in capita procerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:36" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 36</bibl></cit> et saep.: quae nequeat ratio depellere dictis. <hi rend="ital">to deny</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:322" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 322</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13167.9" n="3" level="3"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">dis depellentibus (i. e. averruncantibus) agnam Percute,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:167" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 167</bibl></cit>; cf. depulsor <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
dependeo: <entryFree id="n13168" type="main" key="de_pende^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-pendĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <sense id="n13168.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to hang from</hi> or <hi rend="ital">on, to hang down</hi> (not freq. till the Aug. period; not in Cic. and Caes.—for syn. cf.: pendeo, impendeo). </sense><sense id="n13168.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(anellus) unus ex uno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:915" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 915</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sordidus ex umeris nodo dependet amictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:301" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 301</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dependente a cervicibus pugione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dependent lychni laquearibus aureis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:726" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 726</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">galea ramis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 836</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parma laevo lacerto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 693</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hasta umero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:130" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serta tectis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:760" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 760</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervina vellera lateri sinistro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:593" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 593</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui coma dependet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 224</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laqueo dependentem invenere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dependente brachio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:82" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 82</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:267" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 267</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec dependes nec propendes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>weighest neither less nor more</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Asin. 2, 2, 39</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13168.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n13168.3" n="A" level="2"> (Only in Ovid.) <hi rend="ital">To be dependent on</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wait for</hi> a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">promissa tarda videntur, dependetque fides a veniente die,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:356" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 356</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13168.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To be dependent on, to be governed by</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex horum (siderum) motibus fortunae populorum dependent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ad Marc. 18:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> ad Marc. 18, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13168.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To depend on, be derived from</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex hoc malo dependet illud teterrimum vitium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. An. 12:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tranq. An. 12, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec (membra) ex illis (elementis) dependent, illa et horum causae sunt et omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 95, 12</bibl></cit>.—Hence of etymol. dependence, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to be derived</hi>: hujus et augurium dependet<cb n="DEPE" />  origine verbi (sc. augustus) Et quodcumque sua Juppiter auget ope, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:611" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 611</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dependo: <entryFree id="n13169" type="main" key="de_pendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-pendo</orth>, <itype>di, sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <sense id="n13169.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> (orig., to weigh out; hence), <hi rend="ital">to pay</hi> (rare but class.). </sense><sense id="n13169.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">mi abjurare certius est quam dependere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:1:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:8:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 22, 8, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:6:42 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 12, 6, 42 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dependendum tibi est, quod mihi pro illo spopondisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 9</bibl></cit>: cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13169.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">reipublicae poenas aut praesenti morte aut turpi exsilio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:67:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 67, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poenas reip.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 5, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13169.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to spend, expend, lay out, bestow</hi> upon a thing (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">plus in operis servorum avocandis quam in pretio rerum hujusmodi dependitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:20" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 20</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">incassum impenditur opera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:22:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 22, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora Niliaco amori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 80</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">caput felicibus armis,</quote> <trans><tr>to give up, abandon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 101</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dependulus: <entryFree id="n13170" type="main" key="de_pendu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēpendŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>dependeo</etym>, <sense id="n13170.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hanging down</hi> (an Apuleian word): <cit><quote lang="la">crines cervice, Ap. M. 2, p. 119: alii statuis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:ib. 3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 3</bibl></cit>, p. 130, 14.</sense></entryFree>
depennatus: <entryFree id="n13171" type="hapax" key="de_penna_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-pennātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>penna</etym>, <sense id="n13171.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">winged</hi>, trop.: depennato orationis eloquio, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> 561, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
depensio: <entryFree id="n13172" type="main" key="de_pensi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēpensĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>dependo</etym>, <sense id="n13172.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the expenditure, outlay</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">theatralis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Theod.</author> 6, 4, 29</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">lustralis auri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 13, 1, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
deperdo: <entryFree id="n13173" type="main" key="de_perdo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-perdo</orth>, <itype>dĭdi, dĭtum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n13173.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n13173.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To destroy, ruin</hi> (so only in the <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>, and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">sator inopia deperditus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>impoverished</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut est deperditus Io,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>desperately in love</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:30:29" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 30, 29</bibl></cit> (3, 28, 29 M.); cf. <cit><quote lang="la">amore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deperditum intelligitur, quod in rerum natura esse desiit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Dig. 5:3:21" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Dig. 5, 3, 21</bibl></cit>.—More freq. and class., </sense><sense id="n13173.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To lose</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui non solum bona sed etiam honestatem miseri deperdiderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:43:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 43, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitalem sensum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:526" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 526</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">folia (arbores),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 22, 34, § 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:112 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 8, 33, § 112 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum ejus opinionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 54 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonam famam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usum linguae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:562 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 562 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quid ex his deperdat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">paucos ex suis (nostri),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quid apud vos de existimatione sua deperderet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 9, 19</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">quid de libertate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil de jure civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:35:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 35, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paululum admodum de celeritate (stilus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quid Summa deperdat metuens, aut ampliet ut rem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ex naufragio expulsum est ... non est in derelicto, sed in deperdito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:2:21" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 2, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:3:21" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 5, 3, 21</bibl> (for the <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> of deperdo, depereo is used).—Hence, * <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēperdĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (acc. to <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II.), <hi rend="ital">corrupt, abandoned</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:1:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 1, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
depereo: <entryFree id="n13174" type="main" key="de_pe^re^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-pĕrĕo</orth>, <itype>ii</itype> (<sense id="n13174.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fut.</hi> deperiet for -ibit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,030:31:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccl. 31, 7</bibl>), 4, <hi rend="ital">v. n., to go to ruin, perish, die; to be lost, undone</hi>. </sense><sense id="n13174.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">neque adaugescit quicquam neque deperit inde (sc. de materia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:296" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 296</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempestate naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perexigua pars illius exercitus superest, magna pars deperiit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 87</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:31:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 31, 4</bibl>: si servus deperisset, <hi rend="ital">had been lost</hi> (by death or flight), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:3:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 3, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut scida ne qua depereat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui deperiit minor uno mense vel anno,</quote> <trans><tr>has died</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 40</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">(auro) rerum uni nihil igne deperit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 19, § 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decor vultus ejus deperiit,</quote> <trans><tr>faded</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Jacob. 1, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13174.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to be desperately in love with, dying with love for</hi> a person (not in Cic., neither in Verg., Hor., nor Ovid, but freq. in Plaut.).—Constr.: aliquem (amore), more rarely alicujus amore, in aliquo; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut hic te efflictim deperit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquam (with deamare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:1:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 1, 1, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Bac. 3, 3, 66</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 2, 14</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Catull. 100, 2: amore aliquam deperire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 3, 43</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">illum deperit impotente amore, Catull. 35, 12: amore mulierculae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 15</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">amore sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum laceratum corpus, in quo deperibat, intueretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:6:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 6, 8</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">rogas? deperit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 62</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
depetigo: <entryFree id="n13175" type="main" key="de_pe^ti_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-pĕtīgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>petigo</etym>, <sense id="n13175.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a leprosy, scab</hi>, spread over the whole body (v. de, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II. 2. c.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:157" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 157 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf.: scabies deque petigo, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 160, 18</bibl>. <cb n="DEPL" /></sense></entryFree>
depexus: <entryFree id="n13176" type="main" key="de_pexus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēpexus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from depecto.</entryFree>
depictio: <entryFree id="n13177" type="main" key="de_picti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēpictĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>depingo</etym>, <sense id="n13177.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a description, delineation</hi>, Boeth. Geom. 1, p. 1210 al.—</sense><sense id="n13177.1" n="II" level="1"> Rhet. t. t., <hi rend="ital">a characterization</hi>, = characterismus, Auct. Carm. de Fig. 148, p. 68 Halm.</sense></entryFree>
depictus: <entryFree id="n13178" type="main" key="de_pictus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēpictus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from depingo.</entryFree>
depilis: <entryFree id="n13179" type="main" key="de_pi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-pĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. pilus</etym>, <sense id="n13179.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">without hair</hi> (very rare): genae, Ap. M. 7, p. 191: pueri (with glabri), Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 530, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
depilo: <entryFree id="n13180" type="main" key="de_pi^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-pĭlo</orth>, no <sense id="n13180.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to pull out the hair, pluck out the feathers</hi>. </sense><sense id="n13180.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. (ante-class. and post-Aug., and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">depilari magis quam amiciri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perdicem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:6:3" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 6, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:28" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">struthiocamelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. Sap. 17" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. Sap. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amygdalae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:2:2" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 2, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13180.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, dēpĭlātus, <hi rend="ital">plucked</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">plundered, cheated</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 36, 28</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13180.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To rub off the skin, peel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis umerus depilatus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:29:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 29, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
depingo: <entryFree id="n13181" type="main" key="de_pingo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-pingo</orth>, <itype>pinxi, pictum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n13181.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf. syncop.</hi> depinxti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 154</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n13181.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To depict, portray, paint, draw, represent by painting</hi> (rare but class.). </sense><sense id="n13181.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabellas obscenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:6:27" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 6, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnam Marathoniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imaginem in tabula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 32</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:10:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 10, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">depinge, ubi sistam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:79" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">idola in pariete,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech 8, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13181.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To paint, color</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos stibio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,014:9:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 4 Reg. 9, 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13181.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, by speech or in thought, <hi rend="ital">to portray, represent, sketch, describe, imagine, conceive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">formam verbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 154</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:63" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in illa (sc. republica), quam sibi Socrates Peripatetico illo in sermone depinxerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam hujusce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:27:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 27, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minuta quaedam nimiumque depicta,</quote> <trans><tr>too elaborately defined</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:12:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 12, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidvis cogitatione,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to imagine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:15:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 15, 39</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 15, 48</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13181.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To embroider</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">depictas gemmatasque indutus paenulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:52" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auro depicta chlamys,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:226" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 226</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
depinnatus: <entryFree id="n13182" type="main" key="de_pinna_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-pinnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n13182.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., feathered, winged</hi>, only trop.: <cit><quote lang="la">orationis eloquium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:Sat. Menip. 58:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> Sat. Menip. 58, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
deplaco: <entryFree id="n13183" type="main" key="de_pla_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-plāco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n13183.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to appease, propitiate</hi>: aliquem sibi hostiis, Mythogr. Vatic. 1, 231, p. 71 ed. Bod.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 3, 6</bibl> dub.</sense></entryFree>
deplango: <entryFree id="n13184" type="main" key="de_plango"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-plango</orth>, <itype>nxi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n13184.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to express grief by beating the breast; to bewail, lament</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">Cadmeida palmis Deplanxere domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:546" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 546</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">14, 580</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 1852" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 1852</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">antiqua peccata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Jes. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
deplano: <entryFree id="n13185" type="main" key="de_pla_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-plāno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n13185.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to level off, to make level</hi> or <hi rend="ital">even</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">montes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 12, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> A. V. 3</bibl></cit>. 19.</sense></entryFree>
deplanto: <entryFree id="n13186" type="main" key="de_planto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-planto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n13186.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To take off a twig</hi> or <hi rend="ital">shoot</hi>. </sense><sense id="n13186.1" n="A" level="2"> Prop., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:40:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 40, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgulas de cytiso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 1:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 43</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13186.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to break off</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ramum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:26" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13186.3" n="II" level="1"> = demitto, <hi rend="ital">to set in the ground, to plant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 16, 26, § 121</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:146" default="NO" valid="yes">17, 20, 33, § 146</bibl>; cf. Voss. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 65</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
depleo: <entryFree id="n13187" type="main" key="de_ple^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-plĕo</orth>, <itype>ēvi, 2</itype>, <sense id="n13187.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to empty out, to draw off</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">oleum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:64" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 64 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:50:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 50, 8</bibl>, and 10: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinem,</quote> <trans><tr>to let blood, to bleed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 16, 43, § 148</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which, d. animal,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> A. V. 1, 13, 4</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to exhaust</hi>, haustu fontes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,003:1:8" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Ach. 1, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam querelis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 4, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
depletura: <entryFree id="n13188" type="main" key="de_ple_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēplētūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>depleo</etym>, <sense id="n13188.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bloodletting</hi>, Edict. Diocl. 7, 21.</sense></entryFree>
deplexus: <entryFree id="n13189" type="hapax" key="de_plexus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-plexus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>plector</etym>, <sense id="n13189.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">clasping, grasping</hi> any thing, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1321" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1321</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
deplorabundus: <entryFree id="n13190" type="hapax" key="de_plo_ra_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēplōrābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>deploro</etym>, <sense id="n13190.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">weeping bitterly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:4:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 4, 38</bibl> (also ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 509, 7</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
deploratio: <entryFree id="n13191" type="main" key="de_plo_ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-plōrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n13191.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lamenting, bewailing</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. Consol. ad Marc. 9</bibl>; Ep. 74 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
deploro: <entryFree id="n13192" type="main" key="de_plo_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-plōro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n13192.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n13192.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr., to weep bitterly, to moan, wail, lament, complain</hi>. </sense><sense id="n13192.2" n="A" level="2"> Prop. (repeatedly in Cic.; <cit><quote lang="la">elsewh. not so used): afflictus et jacens et lamentabili voce deplorans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de suis incommodis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 27</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">de aliqua re,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 18</bibl></cit>, § 45 (with conqueri); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 6, 14</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n13192.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of the vine: <hi rend="ital">to weep, bleed greatly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 30</bibl>.—Far more freq. and <pb n="550" /> <cb n="DEPO" /> class., </sense><sense id="n13192.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act., to weep for bitterly, bewail, lament, deplore</hi>. </sense><sense id="n13192.5" n="A" level="2"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">si ad scopulos haec conqueri ac deplorare vellem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">damnationem illam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:24:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 24, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen reipublicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> (with lamentari); <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 23, 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:39:115" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 39, 115</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae nostri aequales deplorare solebant, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 3, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante omnes deplorati erant equites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 40 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae de altero deplorentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:52:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 52, 211</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">multa de Gnaeo deplorabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13192.6" n="B" level="2"> Since the Aug. per., meton. (effectus pro causa, to weep for as lost, i. e.), <hi rend="ital">to regard as lost, to give up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">suam quisque spem, sua consilia, communibus deploratis exsequentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:40:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 40, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deploratur in perpetuum libertas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:38:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 38, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 41, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paene Romanum nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:128" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:18:15" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 18, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deplorata spes est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">vota (coloni),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:272" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 272</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jason a medicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:166 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 50, 51, § 166 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n13192.7" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of the disease, <hi rend="ital">hopeless, incurable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurium vitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 6, 39, § 135</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
deplumis: <entryFree id="n13193" type="main" key="de_plu_mis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-plūmis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pluma</etym>, <sense id="n13193.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">without feathers, featherless</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nudae atque deplumes (hirundines),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 24, 34, § 70</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
depluo: <entryFree id="n13194" type="main" key="de_plu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-plŭo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ūtum, ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n13194.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to rain down</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">multus in terras deplueretque lapis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:72" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 72</bibl></cit>; (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:20:8" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 20, 8</bibl> (3, 13, 8 M.), the true reading is defluit; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:206" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 206</bibl> <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): depluta terra, <hi rend="ital">drenched</hi>, Boëth. Arist. analyt. post. 2, 13.</sense></entryFree>
depolio: <entryFree id="n13195" type="main" key="de_po^li^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-pŏlĭo</orth>, no <sense id="n13195.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, ītum, 4, <hi rend="ital">v. a., to smooth off, polish off</hi> (very rare). </sense><sense id="n13195.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid cote,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 25, 63, § 188</bibl></cit>. —Comic.: <cit><quote lang="la">dorsum meum virgis,</quote> <trans><tr>to cudgel</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 85</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13195.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: DEPOLITUM perfectum, quia omnes perfectiones antiqui politiones appellabant, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=71:20" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 71, 20</bibl> Müll.; cf. the foll. art.</sense></entryFree>
depolitio: <entryFree id="n13196" type="hapax" key="de_po^li_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēpŏlītĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>depolio, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II., a careful smoothing or finishing; hence, concr.</etym>, <sense id="n13196.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a perfection, finished</hi> or <hi rend="ital">perfect thing</hi>: agri depolitiones, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 66, 29</bibl>; cf. the preced. art.</sense></entryFree>
depompatio: <entryFree id="n13197" type="hapax" key="de_pompa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēpompātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>depompo</etym>. <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, a depriving of ornament; hence, <sense id="n13197.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dishonoring</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Christianorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Rufin. 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
depompo: <entryFree id="n13198" type="hapax" key="de_pompo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-pompo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, to deprive of ornament; hence, <sense id="n13198.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to dishonor</hi>, Hier. in Nahum. c. 3.</sense></entryFree>
depondero: <entryFree id="n13199" type="hapax" key="de_ponde^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-pondĕro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n13199.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to press down by its weight, to weigh down</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> Fragm. 26, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
deponens: <entryFree id="n13200" type="main" key="de_po_nens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēpōnens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <sense id="n13200.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr> art. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
depono: <entryFree id="n13201" type="main" key="de_po_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-pōno</orth>, <itype>pŏsŭi, pŏsĭtum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n13201.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> deposivi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 3, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deposivit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 2, 1, 35</bibl></cit>; Catull. 34, 8; <hi rend="ital">inf. perf.</hi> deposisse, <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cat. 8, 16</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">part. sync.</hi> depostus, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 279, 19</bibl>, v. pono), <hi rend="ital">v. a., to lay away, to put</hi> or <hi rend="ital">place aside; to lay, put</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">set down; to lay, place, set, deposit</hi> (freq. in all periods and sorts of writing).—Constr. with <case>acc.</case> alone; or <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">locative</hi> or <case>abl.</case> with or without a <pos>prep.</pos>; or <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">adv. of place where</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">apud</hi> and <hi rend="ital">personal name;</hi> rare and doubtful with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>acc.</case> (cf.
