Krebs, Antibarb. p. 340 sq.). —</sense><sense id="n13201.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n13201.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">caput deponit, condormiscit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 81</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">caput terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:5:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 5, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora (pecudes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:259" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 259</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora sub ramis arboris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fessum latus sub lauru,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 2, 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentum in gremiis mimarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:11:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 11, 24</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">onus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 4, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:23:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 23, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 1:5:3 al" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 1, 5, 3 al.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">onera jumentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:80:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 80, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 4, 32 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 10, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:2 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 2 al.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">depositis in contubernio armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:76:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 76, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma umeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:707" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 707</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anulos aureos et phaleras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coronam, and, shortly after, coronam Romae in aram Apollinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ungues et capillos,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to cut off</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 104, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">comas (for which, shortly before, secuit capillos),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:48:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 48, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 61</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">argenti pondus defossā terrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semina vel scrobe vel sulco,</quote> <trans><tr>to deposit in the earth, to plant</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:4:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 4, 2</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">stirpem vitis aut oleae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:1:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malleolum in terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:10:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 10, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plantas sulcis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 24</bibl></cit> et saep.: exercitum in <cb n="DEPO" /> terram (for exponere), <hi rend="ital">to land</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:5:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 4, 5, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hydriam de umero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:21:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 21, 46</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> of <hi rend="ital">bearing, bringing forth</hi> (as the putting off of a burden): (Latonia) quam mater prope Deliam Deposivit olivam, Catull. 34, 8; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">onus naturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:18:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 18, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:19:4" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 19, 4</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">to lay as a stake, wager: Dam.</hi> Ego hanc vitulam ... Depono. <hi rend="ital">Men.</hi> De grege non ausim quicquam deponere tecum ... verum pocula ponam Fagina, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:31 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 31 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n13201.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n13201.4" n="1" level="3"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to lay up, lay aside, put by, deposit</hi> anywhere; <hi rend="ital">to give in charge to, commit to the care of intrust to</hi> any one: <cit><quote lang="la">non semper deposita reddenda: si gladium quis apud te sana mente deposuerit, repetat insaniens: reddere peccatum sit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:25:95" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 25, 95</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid apud aliquem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Bac. 2, 3, 72</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 20, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:12:section=29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 12, § 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 108 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:49" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:92" default="NO">9, 2, 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 19, 2</bibl> et saep.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">obsides apud eos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:63 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 63 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedam in silvis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 41</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam in templo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunias in publica fide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">also: liberos, uxores suaque omnia in silvas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 19</bibl></cit> (dub.—al. in sylvis; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:23:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 23, 4</bibl> the true reading is in publico): <cit><quote lang="la">impedimenta citra flumen Rhenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:29:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 2, 29, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saucios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:78:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 78, 1</bibl></cit> and 5 et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">pretium in deposito habendum,</quote> <trans><tr>in charge</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:3:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 36, 3, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si pro deposito apud eum fuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:8:8:section=5" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 33, 8, 8, § 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13201.5" n="2" level="3"> </sense><sense id="n13201.6" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To put</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bring down, lay upon the ground</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scio quam rem agat: ut me deponat vino, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>to make drunk</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:6:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 6, 39</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13201.7" n="b" level="4"> Hence (because it was the custom to take a person who had just died out of bed and lay him on the ground), meton.: depositus, <hi rend="ital">dead, just dead</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam prope depositus, certe jam frigidus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Pont. 2, 2, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">depositum nec me qui fleat ullus erit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:3:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 3, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">DEPOSITVS IN PACE,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 5014</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 4874</bibl>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">depositus meus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 133, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13201.8" n="c" level="4"> Also, because the hopelessly sick were often laid on the earth, <hi rend="ital">dying, given up, despaired of</hi>: jam tum depostu' bubulcus Expirans animam pulmonibus aeger agebat, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 279, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deponere est desperare, unde et depositi desperati dicuntur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 279, 30</bibl></cit>: depositus modo sum anima, vita sepultus, Caecil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 279</bibl> (Com. v. 121 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut depositi proferret fata parentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:395" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 395</bibl></cit> Serv.: texere paludes Depositum, Fortuna, tuum, Lucan. 2, 72; <cit><quote lang="la">and transf.: mihi videor magnam et maxime aegram et prope depositam reip. partem suscepisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:2:section=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 2, § 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13201.9" n="3" level="3"> In post-Aug. lang. esp. freq. in the jurists, of buildings, etc., <hi rend="ital">to pull down, take down, demolish, overthrow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedificium vel arboris ramos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:2:17" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 8, 2, 17</bibl></cit> (shortly after, qui <hi rend="ital">tollit</hi> aedificium vel <hi rend="ital">deprimit</hi>); so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:2:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 2, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:3:23" default="NO">41, 3, 23</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">deposita arx,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:4:91" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 4, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuas,</quote> <trans><tr>pull down</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Sev. 14</bibl></cit>: tabulas, <hi rend="ital">destroy</hi>, Capit. Max. duob. 12: <cit><quote lang="la">adversarios tuos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:15:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 15, 7</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n13201.10" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n13201.11" n="A" level="2"> With a predominant notion of putting away, removing, etc., <hi rend="ital">to lay down, lay aside, give up, resign, get rid of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">studia de manibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex memoria insidias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in sermone et suavitate alicujus omnes curas doloresque deponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">petitoris personam capere, accusatoris deponere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">contentionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">certamina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and, bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 37</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. incipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 83:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 83, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. coepisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and with omittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deponere amicitias, suscipere inimicitias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:21:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 21, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:26:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 26, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simultates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:31:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 31, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maerorem et luctum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 14, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnem spem contentionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium adeundae Syriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:32:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 32, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:4:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 4, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:28 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 28 al.</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">provinciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 2, 3</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">dictaturam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:53" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:71" default="NO">5, 10, 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:41" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:543" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 543</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">famem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:530" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 6, 530</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sitim in unda vicini fontis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to quench</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 4, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:50:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 50, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animam,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to die</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13201.12" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To depose</hi> from an office (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">te de ministerio tuo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Is. 22, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13201.13" n="C" level="2"> (Acc. to <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> I. B.) <hi rend="ital">To deposit, intrust, commit to</hi>, for safe-keeping: populi Romani jus in vestra fide ac religione depono, Cic. Caecin. <cb n="DEPO" /> 35 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid rimosa in aure,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid tutis auribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:27:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Od. 1, 27, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo scortum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 13</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēpō-nens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., subst.</hi> (sc. verbum, lit., a verb that lays aside its proper pass. signif.), in the later grammar. a verb which, in a <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> form, has an <hi rend="ital">act.</hi> meaning; <hi rend="ital">deponent</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 143</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 327</bibl> ib.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 787</bibl> ib. sq. et saep.— <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēpŏsĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, and esp. as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēpŏsĭtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">any thing deposited</hi> or <hi rend="ital">intrusted</hi> for safe-keeping, etc., <hi rend="ital">a deposit, trust</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">reddere depositum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:10:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 10, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si depositum non infitietur amicus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:60" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 60</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:3:5 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 36, 3, 5 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contempto Domino negaverit proximo suo depositum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 6, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1</bibl> Tim. 6, 20 al.</sense></entryFree>
depontani: <entryFree id="n13202" type="gloss" key="de_ponta_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēpontāni</orth> <itype>senes appellabantur, qui sexagenarii de ponte deiciebantur</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=75:7" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 75, 7</bibl> Müll.; v. sexagenarius.</entryFree>
deponto: <entryFree id="n13203" type="main" key="de_ponto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēponto</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>de-pons</etym>, <sense id="n13203.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to throw from a bridge</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:Sat. Menip. 82:17" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> Sat. Menip. 82, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
depopulatio: <entryFree id="n13204" type="main" key="de_po^pu^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēpŏpŭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>depopulor</etym>, <sense id="n13204.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a laying waste, marauding, pillaging</hi> (several times in Cic.; <cit><quote lang="la">elsewh. rare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:17:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 17, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 4, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thracum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:22:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 22, 44</bibl></cit>: Tiberini fluminis igniumque, <hi rend="ital">ravages</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 3, 31; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Mic. 2, 4</bibl>. In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 9, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
depopulator: <entryFree id="n13205" type="main" key="de_po^pu^la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēpŏpŭlātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n13205.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who lays waste, a marauder, spoiler, pillager</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 5, 13</bibl></cit>; Caecil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 118, 33</bibl> (v. 191 Rib.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 21, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
depopulatrix: <entryFree id="n13206" type="main" key="de_po^pu^la_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēpŏpŭlātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>depopulator</etym>, <sense id="n13206.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who spoils, destroys</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">generis humani (luxuries),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 11, 3 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
depopulo: <entryFree id="n13207" type="main" key="de_po^pu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēpŏpŭlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. the follg. <sense id="n13207.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
depopulor: <entryFree id="n13208" type="main" key="de_po^pu^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-pŏpŭlor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n13208.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a., to lay waste, ravage, plunder, pillage</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n13208.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut Ambiorigis fines depopularentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 42 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad fines depopulandos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 64, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:24:4" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 24, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:12 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 12 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">agros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 7, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> et saep.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">extrema agri Romani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eam regionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:33:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 33, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicinam humum late,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:10:56" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 10, 56</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">multas domos, plurimas urbes, omnia fana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos fidos nobis rebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 37</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13208.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to waste, lay waste, dissipate, destroy, sweep away</hi>: quos impune depopulatur et dispoliatur dedecus, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 480, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cerealia dona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:684" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 684</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hereditates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:4:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in qua (sc. urbe) omne mortalium genus vis pestilentiae depopulabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aras,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Osee, 10, 2</bibl></cit>.!*? </sense><sense id="n13208.3" n="a" level="4"> Active form <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēpopulo</orth>, āre: agros audaces depopulant servi, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 471, 19</bibl> (Trag. v. 3 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">macellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0013,001:ib. 18" default="NO"><author>Caecil.</author> ib. 18</bibl></cit> (Com. v. 13 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">agros provinciamque, Auct. B. Hisp. 42, 6: greges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:531" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 531</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13208.4" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">depopulor</orth>, <itype>ari</itype>, in pass. signif.: <cit><quote lang="la">communi latrocinio terra omnis depopulabitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Ira D. 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">depopulata est regio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Joel, 1, 10</bibl></cit>. In class. lang. only in the <hi rend="ital">Part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">depopulatis agris,</quote> <trans><tr>laid waste</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 11, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">depopulata Gallia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 77, 14</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">late depopulato agro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis ora maritima depopulata ab Achaeis erat, 37, 4: regiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 15</bibl></cit> et saep.; Justin. 42, 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 53, 54, § 140</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
deportatio: <entryFree id="n13209" type="main" key="de_porta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēportātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>deporto</etym> (rare), <sense id="n13209.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a carrying</hi> or <hi rend="ital">conveying away, a transportation</hi>. </sense><sense id="n13209.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:144:3" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 144, 3</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n13209.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a perpetual banishment, transportation, deportation, exile</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:13:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 13, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:22:6 al" default="NO">48, 22, 6 al.</bibl>; cf. deporto, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II. B.</sense></entryFree>
deportatorius: <entryFree id="n13210" type="hapax" key="de_porta_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēportātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n13210.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">belonging to removal</hi> or <hi rend="ital">transportation</hi>: personale vel deportatorium onus, Cod. 12, 47, 1.</sense></entryFree>
deporto: <entryFree id="n13211" type="main" key="de_porto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-porto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype> (<sense id="n13211.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">arch. inf. pass.</hi> deportarier, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 5, 7, 85</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">v. a., to carry</hi> or <hi rend="ital">convey down; to carry off, to convey away</hi> (freq. and good prose). </sense><sense id="n13211.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">de fundo tigna et oleam ne deportato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:144:3" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 144, 3</bibl></cit>: arma Brundisium jumentis, Pomp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 12</bibl> A. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: frumentum in castra. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:60:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 60, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ossa ejus in Cappadociam ad matrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus Augusti Romam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:100" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 100</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem per vicos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 78</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> et saep.: <pb n="551" /> <cb n="DEPO" /> ut te Leucadem deportaret, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves partem exercitus eo deportaverant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 27</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of transporting by water,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 3, 12, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos (serpentes) flumina deportant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 27, 31, § 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:234" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 103, 106, § 234</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,015:15:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Par. 15, 25</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n13211.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. as a t. t. </sense><sense id="n13211.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To bring</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fetch home</hi> any thing from the provinces: <cit><quote lang="la">victorem exercitum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 21</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:40" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 40</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> al.: <cit><quote lang="la">Tertia tua, quam tu tecum deportaras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliud nihil ex tanta praeda domum suam deportavisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13211.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of abstract objects, <hi rend="ital">to carry away</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to get, acquire</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tertium triumphum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">lauream,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">gloriam ex illis gentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si nihil aliud de hac provincia nisi illius benevolentiam deportassem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te (sc. Atticum) non cognomen solum Athenis deportasse, sed humanitatem et prudentiam intellego,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil ex ista provincia potes, quod jucundius sit, deportare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex Asia deportatum flagitium ac dedecus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 5, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13211.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To banish, transport</hi>, for life (attended with loss of citizenship and testatorship, both of which the relegatus retained, v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:22:7:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 22, 7, § 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:1:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 28, 1, 8</bibl>—mostly post-Aug.— <cit><quote lang="la">for syn. also cf.: exsilio afficio or multo, in exsilium pello or eicio, expello, exigo): inter poenas est etiam insulae deportatio, quae poena adimit civitatem Romanam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:22:7:section=2 sq" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 22, 7, § 2 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vibius Serenus in insulam Amorgum deportatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut liberti quoque Italia deportarentur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in reis deportatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:2:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13211.6" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">non hoc publicitus scelus hinc deportarier In solas terras?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 5, 7, 85</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
deposco: <entryFree id="n13212" type="main" key="de_posco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-posco</orth>, <itype>pŏposci, 3</itype>, <sense id="n13212.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to demand, require, request earnestly</hi> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n13212.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">unum ab omnibus sociis et civibus ad id bellum imperatorem deposci atque expeti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 2, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 15, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">id non modo non recusem, sed etiam appetam atque deposcam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:13:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 13, 33</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so opp. recusare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 38 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:56:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 56, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 1:11:1" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 1, 11, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:2:1:3" default="NO">2, 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pericula (opp. detrectare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 11</bibl></cit> et saep. —<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">de proelio cogitandum, sicut semper depoposcimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 85 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus pollicitationibus deposcunt, qui belli initium faciant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 1, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13212.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n13212.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To demand, request for one's self the performance of any duty</hi> or <hi rend="ital">business</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi id muneris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi partis istas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:34:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 34, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primas sibi partes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:56" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illam sibi officiosam provinciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:chapter=18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">consulatum sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi has urbanas insidias caedis atque incendiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coloniam tutandam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13212.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To demand</hi> a person, in order to bring him to punishment: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad mortem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:110:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 110, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad supplicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:38:3" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 38, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad poenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem morti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad ducem ipsum in poenam foederis rupti deposcendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctorem culpae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Hannibalem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:4:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 32, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ausum Talia deposcunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 200</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:296" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 296</bibl> et saep.: altera me deposcere putabatur, <hi rend="ital">to demand my death</hi>, Cic. post red. in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:13:33" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> 13, 33</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13212.5" n="C" level="2"> (<usg type="style">Transf.</usg> from the gladiator's t. t.) <hi rend="ital">To call out, challenge</hi> one to fight, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:49:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 49, 2</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">hostes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:635" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 635</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
depositarius: <entryFree id="n13213" type="main" key="de_po^si^ta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēpŏsĭtārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>depono, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> I. B.; prop. pertaining to a deposit; hence</etym>, in jurid. Lat., <sense id="n13213.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One who receives a deposit, a trustee, depositary</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:3:1:section=36" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 16, 3, 1, § 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:3:7:section=2" default="NO">16, 3, 7, § 2</bibl> (twice).—</sense><sense id="n13213.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One who makes a deposit, a depositor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:3:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 16, 3, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
depositio: <entryFree id="n13214" type="main" key="de_po^si^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēpŏsĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>depono</etym> (post-Aug.; most freq. in jurid. Lat.). <sense id="n13214.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a laying down, putting off</hi>. </sense><sense id="n13214.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A depositing</hi> for safe-keeping, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:3:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 16, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5" default="NO">5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17" default="NO">17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13214.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A pulling</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tearing down</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedificii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:2:9:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 2, 9, § 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13214.3" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A depositing in the earth, burying</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1121</bibl> (of 384 A.D.).— </sense><sense id="n13214.4" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A parting from, getting rid of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">carnis sordium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 1</bibl></cit> Pet. 3, 21; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tabernaculi mei,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the body</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2</bibl></cit> Pet. 1, 14.— </sense><sense id="n13214.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n13214.6" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: testium, <hi rend="ital">a deposition, testimony</hi>, Cod. 2, 43, 3: dignitatis, <hi rend="ital">a</hi> <cb n="DEPR" /> <hi rend="ital">lowering, degradation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:19:8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 19, 8 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>— </sense><sense id="n13214.7" n="B" level="2"> In rhetor. </sense><sense id="n13214.8" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">The close</hi> of a period: <cit><quote lang="la">prout aut depositio aut inceptio aut transitus postulabit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:46" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 46</bibl></cit> Spald.—</sense><sense id="n13214.9" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">The lowering</hi> of voice, sound, or speed of utterance, = Gr. <foreign lang="greek">qe/sis</foreign> (opp. <foreign lang="greek">a)/rsis</foreign> = elatio), <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 974</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
depositivus: <entryFree id="n13215" type="hapax" key="de_po^si^ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēpŏsĭtīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n13215.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a deposit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniae,</quote> <trans><tr>given in deposit</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 6, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
depositor: <entryFree id="n13216" type="main" key="de_po^si^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēpŏsĭtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym> (post-Aug. and very rare). <sense id="n13216.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One who deposits</hi> a thing for safe-keeping, <hi rend="ital">a depositor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:3:1:section=37" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 16, 3, 1, § 37</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13216.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One who disowns</hi> or <hi rend="ital">disclaims</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">patris natique,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 179</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
depositum: <entryFree id="n13217" type="main" key="de_po^si^tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēpŏsĭtum</orth>, v. depono, <sense id="n13217.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
depositus: <entryFree id="n13218" type="main" key="de_po^si^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēpŏsĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from depono.</entryFree>
depostulator: <entryFree id="n13219" type="main" key="de_postu^la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēpostŭlātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>depostulo</etym>, <sense id="n13219.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who demands</hi> a person, sc. for punishment, torture, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">Christianorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 35</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 50 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
depostulo: <entryFree id="n13220" type="hapax" key="de_postu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-postŭlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n13220.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to demand, require earnestly</hi> ( = the class. deposco): auxilia sibi, Auct. B. Hisp. 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
depotitur: <entryFree id="n13221" type="gloss" key="de_po^ti_tur"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-pŏtītur</orth> <foreign lang="greek">a)polau/ei</foreign>, Gloss. Lat. Gr.</entryFree>
depraedatio: <entryFree id="n13222" type="main" key="de_praeda_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēpraedātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>depraedor</etym>, <sense id="n13222.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plundering</hi> (late Lat.), Cod. 2, 6, 5; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Epit. 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judith, 10, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
depraedator: <entryFree id="n13223" type="main" key="de_praeda_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēpraedātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n13223.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plunderer</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 199" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 199</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
depraedor: <entryFree id="n13224" type="main" key="de_praedor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-praedor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n13224.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> (<hi rend="ital">act.</hi> collat. form depraedaverunt, Ambros. de Fide, 2, 3), <hi rend="ital">to plunder, pillage, ravage</hi> (postclass.; <cit><quote lang="la">for praedor, depopulor): agros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:6:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 24, 6, 3</bibl></cit>; Ap. M. 8, p. 215; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 24, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:33:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Isa. 33, 1</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> signif.: agri, depraedati, Dict. Cretens. 2, 16 Deder. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
depraesentiarum: <entryFree id="n13225" type="main" key="de_praesenti^a_rum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēpraesentĭārum</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>formed after the analogy of impraesentiarum</etym>, <sense id="n13225.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">at present, now</hi> (only in the foll. passages), <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 58, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">74, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
deprandis: <entryFree id="n13226" type="hapax" key="de_prandis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-prandis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>prandeo</etym>, <sense id="n13226.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fasting</hi>: leo, Naev. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=182:24" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 182, 24</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
depravate: <entryFree id="n13227" type="main" key="de_pra_va_te_1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēprāvātē</orth>, <sense id="n13227.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv., perversely, wrongly</hi>, v. depravo <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n13230" type="hapax" key="de_pra_va_te_2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēprāvātē</orth>, <sense id="n13230.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv., perversely, wrongly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque depravate judicare neque corrupte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:21:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 21, 71</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
depravatio: <entryFree id="n13228" type="main" key="de_pra_va_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēprāvātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>depravo</etym>, <sense id="n13228.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a perverting, distorting, corrupting, vitiating</hi> (freq. in Cic.; elsewh. rare). </sense><sense id="n13228.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">distortio et depravatio quaedam (membrorum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:12:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 12, 35</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pedum, manuum, articulorum omnium depravationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 24" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 24 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:62:252" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 62, 252</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13228.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">depravatio et foeditas animi (c. c. deformitas corporis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:29:105" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 29, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:36:127" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 36, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consuetudinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:10:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 10, 29</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostra (c. c. superstitio),</quote> <trans><tr>perversity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:67:136" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 67, 136</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
depravo: <entryFree id="n13229" type="main" key="de_pra_vo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-prāvo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>pravus</etym>, <sense id="n13229.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to pervert, distort, disfigure</hi> (opp. dirigere, corrigere; good prose). </sense><sense id="n13229.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">depravata corrigere crura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 11</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">opp. corrigere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(oculi) uni animalium homini depravantur, unde cognomina Strabonum et Paetorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 55, § 150</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13229.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to pervert, seduce, corrupt, deprave</hi> (for syn. cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">corrumpo, vitio, adultero, perdo, pessum do, illicere, pellicere, adducere): nihil est quin male narrando possit depravarier,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 4, 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jureconsultorum ingeniis pleraque corrupta ac depravata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:12:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 12, 27</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">so with corrumpere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Campanos) nimiae rerum omnium copiae depravabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 35 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer indulgentia nostra depravatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferarum natura malā disciplinā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mores hac dulcedine corruptelaque depravati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:15:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 15, 38</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">consuetudo depravata (opp. recta),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=18" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 18</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">institutum hominis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> Marc. 29, 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inania verba in hos modos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:100" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 100</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 3, 6</bibl> et saep.: seductus ac depravatus ab aliquo, *<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 7</bibl>; cf.: magna pars gratiā depravata, *<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 15, 2</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">plebem consiliis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corruptos depravatosque mores parens noster reformet atque corriget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:53:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 53, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">depravatum est cor per mulieres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 3 Reg. 11, 4</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">solent domestici depravare nonnumquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—Hence,</sense></entryFree>
deprecabilis: <entryFree id="n13231" type="main" key="de_pre^ca_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēprĕcābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>deprecor</etym>, <sense id="n13231.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that</hi> <cb n="DEPR" /> <hi rend="ital">may be entreated, exorable</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:90:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 90, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
deprecabundus: <entryFree id="n13232" type="hapax" key="de_pre^ca_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēprĕcābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n13232.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">earnestly entreating</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deprecabundus et genibus principis accidens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 53</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
deprecaneus: <entryFree id="n13233" type="hapax" key="de_pre^ca_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēprĕcānĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n13233.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">exorable</hi>: fulmina, quae speciem periculi sine periculo afferunt, Caecinna ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:49" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 49</bibl> (dub.—al. dentanea).</sense></entryFree>
deprecatio: <entryFree id="n13234" type="main" key="de_pre^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēprĕcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n13234.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a warding off</hi> or <hi rend="ital">averting by prayer; a deprecating, deprecation</hi>. </sense><sense id="n13234.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. </sense><sense id="n13234.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: periculi. Cic. Rab. perd. 9, 26: venia deprecationis, Quint. prooem. § 2.—</sense><sense id="n13234.3" n="b" level="4"> Esp., in relig. lang., <hi rend="ital">an imprecation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">defigi diris deprecationibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 2, 4, § 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deorum,</quote> <trans><tr>an invoking of the gods to send punishment on the perjurer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:16:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 16, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 18, 1</bibl>.—More freq., </sense><sense id="n13234.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a prayer for pardon, deprecation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejus facti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:chapter=37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 37 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">inertiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8</bibl></cit> prooem. § 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 3, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">assidua,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Jacob. 5, 16</bibl></cit>.—So in rhetoric, like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">proparai/thsis</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">suggnw/mh</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 53 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:32 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 32 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
deprecatiuncula: <entryFree id="n13235" type="main" key="de_pre^ca_ti^uncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēprĕcātĭuncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>deprecatio</etym>, <sense id="n13235.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little deprecation, a trifling plea for pardon</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Salv.</author> adv. Avar. 3, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
deprecativus: <entryFree id="n13236" type="main" key="de_pre^ca_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēprĕcātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>deprecor</etym>, <sense id="n13236.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">deprecative</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qualitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, § 457</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fortun.</author> Art. Rhet. 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 2, 21, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
deprecator: <entryFree id="n13237" type="main" key="de_pre^ca_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēprĕcātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n13237.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who averts by praying; an interceder, intercessor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hujus periculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:chapter=18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miseriarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causae suae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non solum sui deprecator, sed etiam accusator mei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 8, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: ego apud consulem deprecator defensorque vobis adero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunarum alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:42:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 42, 102</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">salutis meae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:12:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 12, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deprecatorem me pro illius periculo praebeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legatos deprecatoresque ad aliquem mittere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 9, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
deprecatorius: <entryFree id="n13238" type="hapax" key="de_pre^ca_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēprĕcātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>deprecator</etym>, <sense id="n13238.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">deprecatory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,023:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Macc. 10, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
deprecatrix: <entryFree id="n13239" type="main" key="de_pre^ca_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēprĕcātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>deprecator</etym>, <sense id="n13239.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female intercessor</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
depreciator: <entryFree id="n13240" type="main" key="de_pre^ci^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēprĕcĭātor</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēprĕcĭo</orth>, v. depretiator and depretio.</entryFree>
deprecor: <entryFree id="n13241" type="main" key="de_pre^cor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-prĕcor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n13241.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n13241.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To avert, ward off</hi> (from one's self or others) <hi rend="ital">by earnest prayer; to deprecate;</hi> also <hi rend="ital">to pray, to intercede</hi> for the averting of any evil, or to obtain pardon for any transgression (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:16:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 16, 3</bibl>). </sense><sense id="n13241.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (for syn. cf.: averto, averrunco, avoco, revoco —freq. and class.), constr. with the <hi rend="ital">acc. (rei v. personae)</hi>, the <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, the <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf., ne, quominus, quin</hi>, and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n13241.3" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc. rei</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ullam ab sese calamitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 60 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut a me quandam prope justam patriae querimoniam detester ac deprecer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 11</bibl></cit>: quibus servitutem mea miseria deprecor? Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:16:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 16, 9</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ego meae cum vitae parcam, letum inimico deprecer?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> § <cit><quote lang="la">10: qui nullum genus supplicii deprecatus est neque recusavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:22:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 22, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:40:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 40, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">non jam mortem neque aerumnas, tantummodo inimici imperium et cruciatus corporis deprecor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 24:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 24, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">periculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 5</bibl></cit>; Asin. Pollio ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:31:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 31, 3</bibl> (with refugere), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">poenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignominiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iram senatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecipiendi munus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:12:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 12, 12</bibl></cit> et saep.—Of abstract subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">Claudii invidiam Gracchi caritas deprecabatur,</quote> <trans><tr>averted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 2</bibl></cit> (ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:16:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 16, 11</bibl>; and <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 290, 17</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n13241.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc. pers.</hi>, usually in the sense of <hi rend="ital">praying</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem deprecarentur, cum omnes essent sordidati?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 12</bibl></cit>: in hoc te deprecor, ne, etc., Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Patres, ne festinarent decernere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatum litteris deprecatus est, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:29" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dispensatorem deprecati sumus, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 30, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deos mala (opp. bona rogare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:33" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 33</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc superos, hoc te quoque deprecor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:53" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numina versu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 133, 2</bibl></cit>: Dominum, Vulg. <pb n="552" /> <cb n="DEPR" /> Esth. 14, 3 et saep.—Less freq. in the sense of <hi rend="ital">averting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lecto te solum, lecto te deprecor uno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:34:17" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 34, 17</bibl></cit> (3, 32, 7 M.).—</sense><sense id="n13241.5" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbram accipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:116" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 116</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 213</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n13241.6" n="(d)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf., to plead in excuse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam errasse regem et Jugurthae scelere lapsum deprecati sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 104:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 104, 4</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">primum deprecor, ne me, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unum petere ac deprecari ... ne se armis despoliaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:31:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 31, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spem ne nostram fieri patiare caducam, deprecor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15</bibl></cit> (16), 170; cf. <hi rend="ital">no.</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">opp. to postulo ut,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:15:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 15, 8</bibl></cit>.—And with the <case>dat.</case> of the person for whom one entreats: deprecari alicui ne vapulet, Plaut. As. grex 5.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">quominus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque illum se deprecari, quominus pergat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 9, 10</bibl></cit> (but non precarere is the true reading in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:24:79" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 24, 79 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>).—So very rarely (<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) with <hi rend="ital">quin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin gravedinem ipsi ferat frigus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:44:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 44, 18</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">q</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> (rarely): <cit><quote lang="la">deprecatus esse dicitur, ut se tertium in amicitiam reciperent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 17, 23</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">supra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 30, 9</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">i</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro amico, pro republica deprecari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma deponat, roget, deprecetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:40:138" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 40, 138</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 7, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 2</bibl>; *<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:931 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 931 al.</bibl>— </sense><sense id="n13241.7" n="B" level="2"> In relig. lang., <hi rend="ital">to imprecate</hi>: diras devotiones in eum deprecata, Ap. M. 9, p. 227.—</sense><sense id="n13241.8" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi non totidem mox deprecor illi Assidue,</quote> <trans><tr>execrate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:92:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 92, 3</bibl></cit> (dictum est quasi detestor vel exsecror vel depello vel abominor, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:16:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 16, 5</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n13241.9" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To pray for, intercede in behalf of</hi> (that which is in danger): <cit><quote lang="la">vitam alicujus ab aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:chapter=26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 26</bibl></cit>; cf. vitam sibi, Auct. B. Afr. 89, 3; <cit><quote lang="la">paucos dies exsolvendo donativo deprecatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos senatus non ad pacem deprecandam, sed ad denuntiandum bellum miserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 24</bibl></cit>. Also with personal objects: <cit><quote lang="la">a vobis deprecor custodem salutis meae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:42:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 42, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullae sunt imagines, quae me a vobis deprecentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 36 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te assiduae lacrimae C. Marcelli deprecantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—Sometimes, by zeugma, deprecor is used in both senses, I. and II., with different objects: non mortem sed dilationem mortis deprecantur, Justin. 11, 9, 14; Gronov. ad loc.!*? <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēprĕcātus</orth>, in pass. signif.: <cit><quote lang="la">deprecatum bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:5:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 8, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: deprecato summo numine, Ap. M. 11, p. 270.</sense></entryFree>
deprehendo: <entryFree id="n13242" type="main" key="de_pre^hendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-prĕhendo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēprendo</orth> (v. prehendo; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:59" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 59</bibl>), <itype>di, sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n13242.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To take</hi> or <hi rend="ital">snatch away</hi>, esp. any thing which is in motion; <hi rend="ital">to seize upon, catch</hi> (freq. and class.—For syn. cf.: invenio, reperio, nanciscor; offendo, aperio, patefacio, detego; incido, consequor, assequor, etc.). </sense><sense id="n13242.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">deprehensus ex itinere Cn. Magius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:24:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 24, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ipso fluminis vado deprehensus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:58:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 5, 58, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in agris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ponte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuntiorum pars deprehensa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 45</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">deprehensis internuntiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 112 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: tabellarios deprendere litterasque intercipere, Cassius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 12</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae deprehensae,</quote> <trans><tr>intercepted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">onerarias naves,</quote> <trans><tr>to seize, take possession of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:36:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 36, 2</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:58:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 58, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:26 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 26 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">volucres jaculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:566" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 566</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursu deprendere telum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:568" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 568</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subito deprehensus locutus est,</quote> <trans><tr>taken by surprise</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 11:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 11, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13242.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> of inanimate subjects. So, esp. freq. of storms: <cit><quote lang="la">deprensa navigia,</quote> <trans><tr>caught, overtaken by</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:429" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 429</bibl></cit>; cf. Catull. 25, 13; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:421" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 421</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:663" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 663</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 4</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n13242.3" n="II" level="1"> In a wider sense, <hi rend="ital">to catch, overtake, surprise, apprehend, detect, find out, discover</hi> any one, esp. in doing any thing wrong. </sense><sense id="n13242.4" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">deprehendi in aliquo manifesto scelere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 43</bibl></cit>;
