so, <cit><quote lang="la">in maximo scelere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 46:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 46, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:50:4" default="NO" valid="yes">50, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in facinore manifesto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 68 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in alio maleficio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:4:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in adulterio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:68:275" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 68, 275</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Johan. 8, 3</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">dolis deprehensus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Bac. 4, 9, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nocte ferro deprehensus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:6:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 6, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine duce et sine equitatu deprehensis hostibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:52:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 52, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(mulier) deprensa,</quote> <trans><tr>caught in the act</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 131</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">134</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 4, 114</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in mendacio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 7, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquos flentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:ib. 7:9:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 9, 11</bibl></cit>: agendi subita necessitate<cb n="DEPR" />  deprehensi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 12, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:21" default="NO">1, 8, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem occisum, Suet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Caes.</author> 35</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n13242.5" n="b" level="4"> Of inanimate objects: <cit><quote lang="la">venenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 7, 20</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 47</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">res furtiva in domo deprehensa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:49" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 49</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">sacrilegium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 6, 26</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n13242.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n13242.7" n="1" level="3"> </sense><sense id="n13242.8" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To comprehend, perceive, understand, detect, discover, discern, observe</hi> (chiefly post-Aug. in prose, esp. in Quint.): <cit><quote lang="la">cujus ego facinora oculis prius quam opinione, manibus ante quam suspicione deprehendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:chapter=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid si me stultior ipso deprenderis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum erga se mentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:60" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">falsas gemmas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 13, 76, § 198</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam naturam ejus Pythagoras Samius primus deprehendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 8, 6, § 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 9, 6, § 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:86" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 28, 44, § 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7" default="NO" valid="yes">7</bibl> praef.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 20, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">falsa facilius deprehendere et refellere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:34" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod vix a lectore deprehenditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Livio Patavinitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 56</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 8, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:23" default="NO">5, 13, 23</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n13242.9" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc. et inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">species diversas esse facile est deprehendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:44" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quosdam mitti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deprehenditur vitiose loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13242.10" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To overtake, equal, imitate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenemque puer deprehende parentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:4:74" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 4, 74</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13242.11" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To find, discover, come upon</hi> (always implying mental action, post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">extra carmen non deprendas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod in epistolis Augusti deprehenditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 7, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:71" default="NO">8, 6, 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud Ciceronem mira figurarum mixtura deprehenditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 3, 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13242.12" n="III" level="1"> With the predominant idea of restricting the free movement of an object, <hi rend="ital">to impede, to check, to bring into a strait</hi>. </sense><sense id="n13242.13" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter quas (latebras) deprehensus hostis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:4:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in fovea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:3:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flamina deprensa silvis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>impeded, confined</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viae deprensus in aggere serpens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 273</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 247</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 2, 14</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n13242.14" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to bring into a strait, to embarrass</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deprehensum me plane video atque sentio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deprensi pudorem explicant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:100" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(testes) plus deprehensi nocent, quam firmi et interriti profuissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:11 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 7, 11 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
deprehensio: <entryFree id="n13243" type="main" key="de_pre^hensi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēprĕhensĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>deprehendo, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II.</etym>, <sense id="n13243.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a catching, seizing, surprising; a discovery</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">deprehensione fieri manifestum furem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:2:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:2:43:section=12" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 23, 2, 43, § 12</bibl>: manifesta veneni, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:18:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 18, 50</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
deprehensus: <entryFree id="n13244" type="main" key="de_pre^hensus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēprĕhensus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">deprensus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> from deprehendo.</entryFree>
deprensa: <entryFree id="n13245" type="gloss" key="de_prensa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēprensa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>deprehendo</etym>, <sense id="n13245.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a species of military punishment, more severe than</hi> castigatio, <hi rend="ital">but milder than</hi> ignominia, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=71:15" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 71, 15</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
depresse: <entryFree id="n13246" type="main" key="de_presse_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēpressē</orth>, <sense id="n13246.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv., deeply</hi>, v. deprimo.</sense></entryFree>
depressio: <entryFree id="n13247" type="main" key="de_pressi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēpressĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>deprimo</etym>, <sense id="n13247.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pressing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sinking down, a depression</hi> (not ante-Aug., and very rare), <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundamentorum ad solidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: Socratica nasi, i. e. <hi rend="ital">flat nose</hi> (opp. curva erectio), <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 3, § 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
depressus: <entryFree id="n13248" type="main" key="de_pressus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēpressus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from deprimo.</entryFree>
depretiator: <entryFree id="n13249" type="hapax" key="de_pre^ti^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēprĕtĭātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">deprec-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>depretio</etym>, <sense id="n13249.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who depreciates, a depreciator</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">operum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
depretio: <entryFree id="n13250" type="main" key="de_pre^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēprĕtĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">deprec-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>pretium</etym>, <sense id="n13250.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lower the price of, to undervalue, to depreciate</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n13250.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">vetera corpora depretiata sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2:22" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 2, 22</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:section=212" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, § 212</bibl>: vilescit pretio depretiatus homo, Paul. Nol. carm. 22, 56.—</sense><sense id="n13250.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (eccl. Lat.), <hi rend="ital">to disregard, make light of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Epicurus omnem dolorem depretiat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
deprimo: <entryFree id="n13251" type="main" key="de_pri^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-prĭmo</orth>, <itype>pressi, pressum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>premo</etym>, <sense id="n13251.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to press down, weigh down, sink down, to depress</hi> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n13251.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n13251.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">vis venti nubem deprimit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:432" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 432</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (Critolaus) tantum propendere illam lancem putet, ut terram et maria deprimat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:30:92" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 30, 92</bibl>: deprimi in tenebras, id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad mentum depresso supercilio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pis. 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus caelestis ex altissimo domicilio depressus et quasi demersus in terram,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">depresso aratro (sc. in terram),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 45</bibl></cit> et saep.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec quae porto deprimunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:4:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 4, 1, 9</bibl></cit>.— <cb n="DEPS" /> </sense><sense id="n13251.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n13251.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To sink deep</hi>, as a plant, a well, etc.; <hi rend="ital">to plant deep, to dig deep</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vites in terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:32" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 32 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 1, 3, § 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plantas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:28" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 28</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui tollit aedificium, vel deprimit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:2:17:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 8, 2, 17, § 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxum in mirandam altitudinem depressum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 27</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">valle in altitudinem depressa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:9:2" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus circiter duodecim pedes humi depressus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 55:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 55, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fossam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:40:3" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 40, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deprimere vel allevare rivum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:4:11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 8, 4, 11</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n13251.5" n="2" level="3"> Naut. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to sink to the bottom, to sink</hi>, sc. a ship: <cit><quote lang="la">partem navium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 58 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 6</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 2, 7; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,009:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Con. 4, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lenunculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 43 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carinam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 185</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 79</bibl>: classis superata atque depressa, Cic. de imp. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1321,001:8:21" default="NO"><author>Pomp.</author> 8, 21</bibl> et saep. —</sense><sense id="n13251.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n13251.7" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To press down, depress</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus depressus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 53</bibl></cit>: vos, gemi nae voragines scopulique reipublicae, vos meam fortunam deprimitis? vestram extollitis? (a figure borrowed from the sinking of a ship, <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">supra</ref></xr>, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> I. B. 2), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 18</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">improbitate depressa veritas emergit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:65:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 65, 183</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita se quisque extollit, ut deprimat alium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 65 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:44:6" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 44, 6</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">preces,</quote> <trans><tr>to suppress, silence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 22, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc quid elocutio attollat aut deprimat dicendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: depressus in ludum, i. e. <hi rend="ital">pressed, forced</hi>, Asin. Pollio ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:32:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 32, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13251.8" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">to depreciate</hi> in words, <hi rend="ital">disparage</hi> (cf. depretio): <cit><quote lang="la">adversariorum causam per contemptionem deprimere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 5, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:16:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 16, 22</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13251.9" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To oppress</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">populum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 2</bibl></cit> Esdr. 5, 15.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēpressus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n13251.10" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, pressed down, i. e. <hi rend="ital">deep, lying low, depressed</hi> (perh. only post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">humilius et depressius iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 26, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquaeductus depressior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 65" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">depresso loco castra ponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 1:5:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Strat. 1, 5, 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13251.11" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of the voice, <hi rend="ital">low, suppressed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam sedatissima et depressissima vox,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 14</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-pressē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">deeply; pos.</hi> not found.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fodere, quo depressius aestivos specus foderint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Helv. 9:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Helv. 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pastinare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
deproelior: <entryFree id="n13252" type="main" key="de_proeli^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-proelĭor</orth>, <itype>āri, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, only in <sense id="n13252.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Part., warring violently</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventos aequore fervido Deproeliantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:9:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 1, 9, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
depromo: <entryFree id="n13253" type="main" key="de_pro_mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-prōmo</orth>, <itype>prompsi</itype> (-msi), promptum (-mtum), 3, <sense id="n13253.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to draw out, draw forth; to bring, to fetch</hi> from anywhere, esp. out of any place (rare but class.).—Constr., usu. <case>abl.</case> w. <hi rend="ital">ex</hi> or <hi rend="ital">de</hi> of things, with <hi rend="ital">a</hi> of persons; <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and late Lat. with <case>abl.</case> alone, but domo depromere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:66:section=155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 66, § 155</bibl>. </sense><sense id="n13253.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam ex arca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 15</bibl></cit>; cf.: pecuniam ex aerario, id. de imp. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1321,001:13:37" default="NO"><author>Pomp.</author> 13, 37</bibl>, and <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II.: <cit><quote lang="la">tela pharetris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:501" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 501</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">11, 590: gramina loculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:749" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 749</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caecubum cellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:37:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 1, 37, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibum servis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 104</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 2, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:3:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 3, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">merum Sabinā diotā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 1, 9, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">condo et compono quae mox depromere possim,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13253.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, comic.: <cit><quote lang="la">e promptuaria cella depromi ad flagrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13253.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">e quibus locis, quasi thesauris argumenta depromerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so with <hi rend="ital">ex</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:21:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 21, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:6:15 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 6, 15 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">juris utilitatem vel a peritis vel de libris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:59:252" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 59, 252</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">de jure civili depromptum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 57, 244</bibl></cit>; c. <case>abl.</case> alone: <cit><quote lang="la">sinu vires,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:450" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 450</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
depropero: <entryFree id="n13254" type="main" key="de_pro^pe^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-prŏpĕro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n13254.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n13254.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr., to make great haste, to hasten</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cito introite, et cito deproperate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 6, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13254.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act., to hasten</hi> or <hi rend="ital">accelerate greatly, to prepare hastily</hi> (very rare): coronas, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:7:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 2, 7, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">miserabile humandi munus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:265" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 265</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> as object: <cit><quote lang="la">sacruficare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 108</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
deproperus: <entryFree id="n13255" type="main" key="de_pro^pe^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-prŏpĕrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = de-properans, <sense id="n13255.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">making great haste, hastening</hi>, Cod. Th. 7, 1, 13 (cf. Cod. 12, 36, 12).</sense></entryFree>
depropitio: <entryFree id="n13256" type="main" key="de_pro^pi^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-prŏpĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)cila/skomai</foreign>, <sense id="n13256.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to propitiate, reconcile</hi>, Vulg. Interp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Quest. in Hept. 2:133" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Quest. in Hept. 2, 133</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
depso: <entryFree id="n13257" type="main" key="depso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">depso</orth>, <itype>sui, stum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">deye/w</foreign>, to <sense id="n13257.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">knead</hi>. </sense><sense id="n13257.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">id ubi excoxeris, depsito bene,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 90</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 76</bibl>: lu <pb n="553" /> <cb n="DEPU" /> tum, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 40, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">coria,</quote> <trans><tr>to dress, to curry</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 135</bibl></cit>: tibi fortasse alius molit et depsit, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 99, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13257.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in an obscene sense, <hi rend="ital">to dishonor</hi>, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 22, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
depsticius: <entryFree id="n13258" type="hapax" key="depsti_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">depstīcĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-tius</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>depso</etym>, <sense id="n13258.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">kneaded</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">panis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:74" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 74</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
depubes: <entryFree id="n13259" type="gloss" key="de_pu_bes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēpūbes</orth>, <sense id="n13259.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not of full age</hi>: porcus lactens qui prohibitus sit pubes fieri, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=71:23" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 71, 23</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
depudesco: <entryFree id="n13260" type="main" key="de_pu^desco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-pŭdesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n13260.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n., to become shameless</hi> (post-class. and rare): infamiā, Ap. M. 10, p. 253.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: non depudesco infelicitatis meae, <hi rend="ital">am not ashamed</hi>, Hier. ad Eustoch.</sense></entryFree>
depudet: <entryFree id="n13261" type="main" key="de_pu^det"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēpŭdet</orth>, <itype>ŭit, 2</itype>, <sense id="n13261.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. impers.</hi> * </sense><sense id="n13261.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To be greatly ashamed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum eum non depuderet mare infestare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:73" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 73 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n13261.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Not to be ashamed, to become shameless</hi> (perh. not ante-Aug.; <cit><quote lang="la">very rare): depuduit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 4, 155</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">assiduis conviciis depudere didicerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Const. Sap. 17" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Const. Sap. 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
depudico: <entryFree id="n13262" type="hapax" key="de_pu^di_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-pŭdīco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>pudicus</etym>, <sense id="n13262.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to violate, dishonor</hi>: stupro, Laber. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
depugis: <entryFree id="n13263" type="hapax" key="de_pu_gis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-pūgis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">depyg-</orth>), <itype>is</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pyga</etym>, <sense id="n13263.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">without buttocks</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">thin-buttocked</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">a)/pugos</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 93</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
depugnatio: <entryFree id="n13264" type="main" key="de_pugna_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēpugnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>depugno</etym>, <sense id="n13264.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a violent fighting, eager contest</hi> (ante- and postclass.). </sense><sense id="n13264.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 204, 32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 3, 30</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n13264.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n13264.3" n="A" level="2"> Of debate: forensium certaminum depugnationes, Firm. Math. 4 praef.—</sense><sense id="n13264.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A defacing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">humani oris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
depugno: <entryFree id="n13265" type="main" key="de_pugno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-pugno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n13265.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n13265.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To fight eagerly, fight out; to contend, combat violently</hi>. </sense><sense id="n13265.2" n="A" level="2"> Prop. (freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">collatis signis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:5:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 5, 44</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">acie instructā, * Caes, B. G. 7, 28: multi depugnant gemitusque edunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1015" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1015</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud procul moenibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 37</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:34" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 2:4:6" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 2, 4, 6</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">Torquatus cum Gallo apud Anienem depugnavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:22:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 22, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad depugnandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 4, 4</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of single combat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:22:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 22, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:39" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 39</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and as a t. t. of gladiatorial combats,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 17</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; Asin. Pollio, ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:32:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 32, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5, 12</bibl> Spald.; <cit><quote lang="la">in the latter sense also with an object: feram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:1:1:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 1, 1, § 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">bestias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:8:11" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 48, 8, 11</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante depugnabitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 11, 6</bibl></cit>: so, <cit><quote lang="la">depugnarier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:5:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 5, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">depugnatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:39" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 39</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13265.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> out of the milit. sphere: <cit><quote lang="la">cum animo suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum fame,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 4, 2, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:475" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 475</bibl></cit>.—And in a figure borrowed from the lang. of gladiators: <cit><quote lang="la">unum par, quod depugnet, reliquum est voluptas cum honestate,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 46</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">natura atque luxuria depugnant (flores),</quote> <trans><tr>rival one another</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 8, 22, § 46</bibl></cit>: indocti stolidique et depugnare parati, * <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 184</bibl>.—*</sense><sense id="n13265.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To fight to the end, stop fighting</hi>: depugnato proelio, "<hi rend="ital">the day after the fair</hi>," <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:6:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 6, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
depulpo: <entryFree id="n13266" type="gloss" key="de_pulpo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēpulpo</orth>, <sense id="n13266.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to grow lean</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">a/posarkw=</foreign>, Gloss. Lat. Gr. [de-pulpa].</sense></entryFree>
depulsio: <entryFree id="n13267" type="main" key="de_pulsi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēpulsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>depello</etym>. <sense id="n13267.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A driving off, driving away, repelling, warding off</hi>. </sense><sense id="n13267.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">depulsio mali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:13:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 13, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">doloris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servitutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 8, 4, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13267.2" n="B" level="2"> Esp. in rhetor., <hi rend="ital">a defence</hi> against a charge, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:26:79" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 26, 79</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 10, 13</bibl>; Cels. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 13</bibl>; Quint. ib. § 17 al.—* </sense><sense id="n13267.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A lowering, sinking down</hi> of the eyes: <cit><quote lang="la">luminum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:14:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 14, 42</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
depulso: <entryFree id="n13268" type="main" key="de_pulso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēpulso</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n13268.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. int. a.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to thrust away, push aside</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cubitis depulsa de via,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 1, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
depulsor: <entryFree id="n13269" type="main" key="de_pulsor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēpulsor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n13269.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who drives away, removes, repels</hi> (rare): dominatus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 11, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">malorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 14, 13</bibl></cit>: alius vel servator honorum vel malorum depulsor, Boëth. Cons. Phil. 4, 6.—In inscriptions, <hi rend="ital">an epithet of Jupiter, as the averter of evil</hi> (cf. Averruncus), <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2232 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
depulsorius: <entryFree id="n13270" type="main" key="de_pulso_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēpulsōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n13270.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">serving to avert</hi>, sc. evil: <cit><quote lang="la">sacra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 2, 3, § 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 25, 2, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
depulsus: <entryFree id="n13271" type="main" key="de_pulsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēpulsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from depello.</entryFree>
depungo: <entryFree id="n13272" type="hapax" key="de_pungo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-pungo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (to prick down, i. e.), <sense id="n13272.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to mark off, to designate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi sistam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:79" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 79</bibl></cit>. <cb n="DERE" /></sense></entryFree>
depurgatio: <entryFree id="n13273" type="main" key="de_purga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēpurgātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>depurgo</etym>, <sense id="n13273.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cleansing by purgatives</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:4" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:ib. 3:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
depurgativus: <entryFree id="n13274" type="main" key="de_purga_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēpurgātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n13274.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">purifying, purgative</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:16" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
depurgo: <entryFree id="n13275" type="main" key="de_purgo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-purgo</orth>, no <sense id="n13275.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, ātum, 1, <hi rend="ital">v. a., to clean out, cleanse</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">prata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:50:1" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 50, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 112, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terram ab herba,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caules lactucae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:9:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sordes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:14:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 14, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pisces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13275.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp. as med. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to cleanse, clear, purge</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eas partes ex quibus sputa feruntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:18:110" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 18, 110</bibl></cit>; so <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae genus, quod potionibus depurgat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 3, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
deputo: <entryFree id="n13276" type="main" key="de_pu^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-pŭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n13276.0" n="I" level="1">In agriculture, <hi rend="ital">to cut off, prune</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vineam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:49:1" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 49, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">50, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:32" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palmites falce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:7:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malleolum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:10:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 10, 19</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: umbras (i. e. ramos), Ov. de Nuce, 63.—</sense><sense id="n13276.1" n="II" level="1"> Ante- and post-class., <hi rend="ital">to esteem, consider, count as;</hi> and alicui or ad aliquid, in late Lat., <hi rend="ital">to destine, allot</hi> to any one or any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">operam alicujus parvi preti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum iniquis deputari,</quote> <trans><tr>to be classed among</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:22:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 22, 37</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid delicto,</quote> <trans><tr>to impute</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> de Poenit. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne id esse in lucro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 2, 1, 16</bibl></cit> and 21: <cit><quote lang="la">si hoc in rem deputas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me omnes esse dignum deputant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Amph. 1, 1, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 83</bibl>; Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:22:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 22, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tun' virum me deputas esse?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 1, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:27:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 27, 65</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vaccas steriles aratro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mart. 11, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sept. 10, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deputata sibi a natura sedes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 14 al.</bibl></cit>: servos ad gladium ludi, <hi rend="ital">to condemn</hi>, Capit. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
depuvio: <entryFree id="n13277" type="hapax" key="de_pu^vi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-pŭvĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>from pavio; cf. contubernium, from taberna</etym>, <sense id="n13277.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to strike, beat</hi>: palmis misellam depuvit me, Lucil. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=70:3" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 70, 3</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
depygis: <entryFree id="n13278" type="main" key="de_py_gis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-pȳgis</orth>, v. depugis.</entryFree>
deque: <entryFree id="n13279" type="main" key="de_que"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēque</orth>, <sense id="n13279.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">downwards</hi>, v. susque deque.</sense></entryFree>
dequestus: <entryFree id="n13280" type="main" key="de_questus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-questus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [queror], <sense id="n13280.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having deeply deplored, bitterly complained of</hi> (in post-Aug. poetry): <cit><quote lang="la">secum dequesta labores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:448" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 448</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imbres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:404" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 404</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">talia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 627</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
derado: <entryFree id="n13281" type="main" key="de_ra_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-rādo</orth>, <itype>si, sum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n13281.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to rub</hi> or <hi rend="ital">scrape off, to smooth off, shave off</hi> (anteclass. and post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">de virga lauri deradito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:121" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atramentum scalpro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:35" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 26, 35</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">ceram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:9:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 9, 17</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen urbis ex carmine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umorem specillis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 7, 24, § 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corticem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 2, 6, § 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cunctis margo derasis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 8, 20, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capillum ex capite omni,</quote> <trans><tr>to cut off</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:9:22" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 9, 22</bibl></cit>, for which also caput, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> § <cit><quote lang="la">25: deraso capite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 6, 34, § 109</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
deraemestae: <entryFree id="n13282" type="main" key="Deraemestae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Deraemestae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n13282.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people in Dalmatia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 22, 26, § 143</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
derangae: <entryFree id="n13283" type="main" key="Derangae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Derangae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n13283.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of India</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 20, 23, § 76</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
derbe: <entryFree id="n13284" type="main" key="Derbe_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Derbē</orth>, <itype>es</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*de/rbh</foreign>, <sense id="n13284.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fortified city of Lycaonia, residence of Cicero's friend, the tyrant Antipater; a place of refuge for Christians under persecution</hi>, now Divlé, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:14:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 14, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 1</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n13284.1" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Der-bes</orth>, <itype>ētis</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Derbētes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an inhabitant of Derbe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:73:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 73, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13284.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Derbēus</orth>, <itype>ēi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<foreign lang="greek">*derbai=os</foreign>), of Derbe, Gaius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 20, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
derbices: <entryFree id="n13285" type="main" key="Derbi_ces"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Derbīces</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<foreign lang="greek">*de/rbikes</foreign>), <sense id="n13285.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Asia, near the mouth of the Oxus, on the Caspian Sea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:5:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 5, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:2:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 16, 18, § 48</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
derbiosus: <entryFree id="n13286" type="main" key="derbi^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">derbĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n13286.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., scabby</hi> ( = impetiginosus): <cit><quote lang="la">oculi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 1, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dercea: <entryFree id="n13287" type="main" key="derce^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dercĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n13287.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant, called also</hi> herba Apollinaris, <hi rend="ital">a species of the</hi> solanum, Ap. Herb. 22.</sense></entryFree>
dercetis: <entryFree id="n13288" type="main" key="Derce^tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dercĕtis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dercĕto</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*derki/tis</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">*derketw/</foreign>, <sense id="n13288.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Syrian goddess, called also</hi> Atargatis, <hi rend="ital">supposed to be the same with the Greek Aphrodite</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 223" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 223</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 23, 19, § 81</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dercylides: <entryFree id="n13289" type="greek" key="Dercy_li^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dercȳlĭdes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*derkuli/dhs</foreign>, <sense id="n13289.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sculptor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 5, 4, § 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
derectus: <entryFree id="n13290" type="main" key="de_rectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dērectus</orth>, v. <itype>dirigo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>
derelictio: <entryFree id="n13291" type="main" key="de_re^licti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dērĕlictĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>derelinquo</etym>, <sense id="n13291.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an abandoning;</hi> trop., <hi rend="ital">a disregarding, neglecting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">communis utilitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:6:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 6, 30</bibl></cit>. <cb n="DERI" /></sense></entryFree>
derelictor: <entryFree id="n13292" type="main" key="de_re^lictor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dērĕlictor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>derelinquo</etym>, <sense id="n13292.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who abandons</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">legis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Psa. 88</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
derelictus: <entryFree id="n13293" type="main" key="de_re^lictus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dērĕlictus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from derelinquo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n13294" type="hapax" key="de_re^lictus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dērĕlictus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>derelinquo</etym>, <sense id="n13294.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an abandoning;</hi> trop., <hi rend="ital">a neglecting, neglect</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid habere derelictui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:12:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 12, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
derelinquo: <entryFree id="n13295" type="main" key="de_re^linquo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-rĕlinquo</orth>, <itype>līqui, lictum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n13295.0" n="I" level="1"> In the class. lang., <hi rend="ital">to forsake wholly, to abandon, desert</hi> (good prose): cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Ti. Gracchum a Q. Tuberone derelictum videbamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:11:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 11, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut aratores agros latos ac fertiles desererent totasque arationes derelinquerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:51:section=120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 51, § 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serere aliquid in inculto et derelicto solo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:4:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 4, 16</bibl></cit>: naves ab aestu derelictae, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:50:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 50, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. 37, 8, 5; <cit><quote lang="la">10, 17, 5: in arce praesidium dereliquit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perditi atque ab omni non modo fortuna, verum etiam spe derelicti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 10, 25</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut me quasi pro derelicta sis habiturus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 4, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">communem causam (with deserere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:chapter=35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 35 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">desertarum derelictarumque rerum patrocinium suscipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:5:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:12:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 12, 10</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n13295.1" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To leave behind</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in qua (arce) praesidium dereliquit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:4:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filium quem privatum dereliquerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Treb. Pol.</author> Trig. Tyr. 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13295.2" n="II" level="1"> In late Lat., <hi rend="ital">to leave behind, to bequeath</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">libros de gente Romana conscriptos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, p. 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">derelictum magnum aes alienum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 108, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
derepente: <entryFree id="n13296" type="main" key="de_re^pente^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-rĕpentĕ</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> (qs. departing from the regular course of time), <sense id="n13296.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">suddenly, on a sudden</hi> (mostly ante-class—for syn. cf.: desubito, subito, repente, statim, continuo, confestim, actutum, extemplo, etc.): derepente contulit sese in pedes, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 518, 20</bibl>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Att. Afran. Turpil., Novius, Varro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1321,001:ib. 5" default="NO"><author>Pompon.</author> ib. 5</bibl></cit>-22; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 2, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 1, 3</bibl> and 39; Poëta ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:31:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 31, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 63</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:41:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 41, 6</bibl>, the true reading is repente).</sense></entryFree>
derepo: <entryFree id="n13297" type="main" key="de_re_po"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-rēpo</orth>, <itype>psi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n13297.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to crawl down, sneak down</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">derepit ad cubile setosae suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: ad hominum fana, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 544, 29</bibl>; Ap. M. 4, p. 145.—* </sense><sense id="n13297.1" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ursi arborem aversi derepunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 36, 54, § 131</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dereptus: <entryFree id="n13298" type="main" key="de_reptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēreptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from deripio.</entryFree>
derideo: <entryFree id="n13299" type="main" key="de_ri_de^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-rīdĕo</orth>, <itype>si, sum, 2</itype>, <sense id="n13299.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to laugh at, laugh to scorn; to scoff at, deride</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n13299.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes istos deridete atque contemnite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:14:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 14, 54</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with contemnere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 92 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">derisus a suis consiliariis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 39 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Bac. 3, 4, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 4, 2, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:5:8 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 5, 8 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 263</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:452" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 452</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:23" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sabbata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Thren. 1, 7</bibl></cit> et saep.—Prov.: albis dentibus aliquem deridere; v. albus.—</sense><sense id="n13299.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Absol.: Ap.</hi> Age dic. <hi rend="ital">Ep.</hi> At deridebitis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 77</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">derides, in conversation,</quote> <trans><tr>you mock me, are making game of me</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Amph. 3, 3, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Bac. 4, 9, 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">derisum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 5, 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deridet, cum sibi ipsum jubet satis dare Habonium,</quote> <trans><tr>he is mocking</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:56:section=146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 56, § 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Patronus despiciat, derideat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 1, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus derisus Philippus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 9, 2, 10</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">P. a.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dērīsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">absurd, scorned;</hi> only <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">senex derisissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:Sat. Men. 11:20" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> Sat. Men. 11, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
deridiculus: <entryFree id="n13300" type="main" key="de_ri_di^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dērīdĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>derideo</etym>, <sense id="n13300.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very laughable, ridiculous</hi> (not in Cic. and Caes.): <cit><quote lang="la">is deridiculu 'st omnibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pueri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:30:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 30, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:2:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod est deridiculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:18:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 18, 5</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 26</bibl>.—And <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dērīdĭcŭ-lum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">ridicule</hi> (subject.), or (object.) <hi rend="ital">a mockery, game, an object of derision</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid tu me deridiculi gratia sic salutas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 5, 7</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deridiculo esse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deridiculo corporis despiciendus,</quote> <trans><tr>deformity, absurdity</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 49</bibl></cit>: deridiculo haberi, <hi rend="ital">a laughingstock</hi>, Ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1</bibl>, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 3, p. 341, 33.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod evenit usque ad deridicula quaedam,</quote> <trans><tr>in some cases to an absurd extent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 8, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
derigeo: <entryFree id="n13301" type="main" key="de_ri^geo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-rĭgeo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <sense id="n13301.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to remove hardness, to soften</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Commod.</author> 73, 8</bibl>. <pb n="554" /> <cb n="DERI" /></sense></entryFree>
derigesco: <entryFree id="n13302" type="main" key="de_ri^gesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-rĭgesco</orth>, <itype>gŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n13302.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> (occurring only in the <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>), <hi rend="ital">to become stiff</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rigid; to curdle</hi> (a <usg type="style">poet.</usg> word): <cit><quote lang="la">formidine sanguis deriguit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:260" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 260</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deriguere oculi,</quote> <trans><tr>were fixed</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 447</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">oculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:754" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 754</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hirsutae comae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:332" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 332</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:613" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 613</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:233" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 233</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Niobe malis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:303" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 303</bibl></cit> (al. diriguit).</sense></entryFree>
deripio: <entryFree id="n13303" type="main" key="de_ri^pi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-rĭpĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-rupio</orth>), <itype>rĭpŭi, reptum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>rapio</etym>, <sense id="n13303.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to tear off, tear away, snatch away, remove violently; to pull down</hi> (class., esp. freq. in poets). </sense><sense id="n13303.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> constr., with <case>abl.</case> with or without a <pos>prep.</pos>, or rarely with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem de ara,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 6, 2</bibl></cit>; so with <hi rend="ital">de</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 5, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 2, 117</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:2:82 al" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 2, 82 al.</bibl>; with <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 3, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestem a pectore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:637" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 637</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum a latere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 35</bibl></cit>; with <hi rend="ital">ex</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">velamina ex humeris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 567</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum matronis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:10:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 10, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pellem leoni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pignus lacertis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 1, 9, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 15, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amphoram horreo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 28, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qualos fumosis tectis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:242" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 242</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lunam caelo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:46" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 46</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">ensem vaginā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:475" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 475</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ramos arbore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">derepta acus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:14:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 14, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma templis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:600" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 600</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ore frena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:319" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 319</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plaustro derepta nurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:160" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 160</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 45</bibl> et saep.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">facinus indignum, erum meum hic luci derupier in via,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 7, 17</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">e caelo deripit ille deos, of outrageous impiety,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:10:60" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 10, 60</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n13303.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum de mea auctoritate deripuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 1, 2</bibl></cit>.!*? In MSS. and edd. often confounded with diripio q. v.</sense></entryFree>
derisio: <entryFree id="n13304" type="main" key="de_ri_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dērīsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>derideo</etym>, <sense id="n13304.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a laughing to scorn, mockery, derision</hi> (late Lat. for irrisio, illusio), <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, p. 239</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
derisor: <entryFree id="n13305" type="main" key="de_ri_sor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dērīsor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n13305.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mocker, scoffer, satirical person</hi> (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): ut tu semper eris derisor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:433" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 433</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:51" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Anubis derisor populi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:534" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 534</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:9:7 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 9, 7 al.</bibl> Applied to a (jeering) parasite, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 11</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">to a stage mimic,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:5:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 5, 5</bibl></cit>; Orell. Inscr. 4926.</sense></entryFree>
derisorius: <entryFree id="n13306" type="hapax" key="de_ri_so_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dērīsōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>derisor</etym>, <sense id="n13306.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">serving for laughter, ridiculous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">condiciones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:7:14" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 28, 7, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
derisus: <entryFree id="n13307" type="main" key="de_ri_sus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dērīsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from derideo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n13308" type="main" key="de_ri_sus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dērīsus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>derideo</etym>, <sense id="n13308.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mockery, scorn, derision</hi> (perh. not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">facile ad derisum stulta levitas ducitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 7, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 4</bibl> prooem.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 39</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">esp.: in derisum facere,</quote> <trans><tr>to mock, put to scorn</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:20:7 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 20, 7 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Thren. 3, 14</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in derisum habere, dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sap. 5, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
derivamentum: <entryFree id="n13309" type="main" key="de_ri_va_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dērīvāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>derivo</etym>, <sense id="n13309.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a derivation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. ad Paul. 14" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. ad Paul. 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
