derivatio: <entryFree id="n13310" type="main" key="de_ri_va_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dērīvātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>derivo</etym>, <sense id="n13310.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a leading off, turning off, turning away</hi>. </sense><sense id="n13310.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: derivationes fluminum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:4:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 4, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollemnis (sc. lacus Albani),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 15</bibl></cit> (cf. shortly before, priusquam ex lacu Albano aqua emissa foret).—</sense><sense id="n13310.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n13310.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">dictum aliquod in aliquem usum tuum opportuna derivatione convertere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13310.4" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n13310.5" n="1" level="3"> In grammat. lang., <hi rend="ital">derivation, etymology</hi> of words, Plin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Aen. 9, 706</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:57" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 57</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 73</bibl> P. et saep.—</sense><sense id="n13310.6" n="2" level="3"> In rhetor. </sense><sense id="n13310.7" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">An exchanging</hi> of one word for another of like meaning, to soften the expression (as fortis for temerarius, liberalis for prodigus, etc.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 7, 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13310.8" n="(b)" level="5"> As rhet. fig. = <foreign lang="greek">parhgme/non</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the development of a preceding statement</hi> or <hi rend="ital">conception into a new thought</hi>, Jul. Ruf. Schem. Lex. § 14.</sense></entryFree>
derivativus: <entryFree id="n13311" type="main" key="de_ri_va_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dērīvātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, in the later grammat. lang., <sense id="n13311.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">derivative</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 593</bibl></cit> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">species verborum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> p. 824</bibl></cit> ib. et saep.</sense></entryFree>
derivo: <entryFree id="n13312" type="main" key="de_ri_vo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-rīvo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>rivus</etym>, <sense id="n13312.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lead, turn</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">draw off</hi> a liquid, from or to a place. </sense><sense id="n13312.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">de fluvio aquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:12 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 12 sq.</bibl></cit>: aqua ex flumine derivata, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:72:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 72, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:ib. 8:40:3" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> ib. 8, 40, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:15:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 15, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:16:9" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 16, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">derivata in domos flumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:N. Q. 1 praef" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> N. Q. 1 praef.</bibl></cit> 7; 4, 2, 8; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">umorem in conliquias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:8:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 8, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13312.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">to disperse, distribute</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deriventur fontes tui foras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 5, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13312.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n13312.4" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (repeatedly in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">nihil in suam domum inde,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 25</bibl></cit>, <cb n="DERU" /> 72: <cit><quote lang="la">alia ex his fontibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:40" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 17, 40</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc fonte derivata clades,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 3, 6, 19</bibl></cit>: derivare auimum curaque levare, <hi rend="ital">to divert</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:365" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 365</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">derivandi criminis causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:chapter=10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iram alicujus in se,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 2, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">culpam in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 3, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">culpam derivare in rem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partem aliquam curae et cogitationis in Asiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exspectationem largitionis agrariae in agrum Campanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alio responsionem suam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 53</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13312.5" n="B" level="2"> Esp., in gramm., <hi rend="ital">to derive</hi>, sc. one word from another (postAug. for ducere), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:38" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:31" default="NO">8, 3, 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 310</bibl> P. et saep.</sense></entryFree>
derodo: <entryFree id="n13313" type="main" key="de_ro_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-rōdo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. derosus.</entryFree>
derogatio: <entryFree id="n13314" type="main" key="de_ro^ga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dērŏgātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>derogo</etym>, <sense id="n13314.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a partial abrogation of a law, a derogation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tertium est (genus) de legum derogationibus, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Cornel. I. Frag. 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 10, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
derogator: <entryFree id="n13315" type="main" key="de_ro^ga_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dērŏgātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n13315.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a detractor, depreciator</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 3, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
derogatorius: <entryFree id="n13316" type="main" key="de_ro^ga_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dērŏgātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n13316.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">belonging to a derogation</hi> or <hi rend="ital">partial repeal, derogatory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">edictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:25:4:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 25, 4, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
derogito: <entryFree id="n13317" type="hapax" key="de_ro^gi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-rŏgĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n13317.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. intens. a., to ask urgently</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 60</bibl> (dub.).</sense></entryFree>
derogo: <entryFree id="n13318" type="main" key="de_ro^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-rŏgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, jurid. t. t., <sense id="n13318.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to repeal a part</hi> of a law, <hi rend="ital">to restrict</hi> or <hi rend="ital">modify</hi> it. </sense><sense id="n13318.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">huic legi nec obrogari fas est, neque derogari ex hac aliquid licet, neque tota abrogari potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 22</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">de lege aliquid derogare aut legem abrogare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:45:134" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 45, 134</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cornel. I. Frag. 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">derogatur legi, cum pars detrahitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:102" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 16, 102</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13318.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, beyond the legal sphere, <hi rend="ital">to take away, detract from, to diminish, to remove, withdraw</hi>. </sense><sense id="n13318.3" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de magnificentia aut de honestate quiddam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:58:175" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 58, 175</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 17, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de testium fide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:chapter=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n13318.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ex</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid ex hac ipsa (aequitate) accusator derogat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:46:136" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 46, 136</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13318.5" n="(g)" level="5"> With <case>dat.</case> (so most freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">non mihi tantum derogo, tametsi nihil arrogo, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Amm. 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem alicui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 4, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:71:146" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 71, 146</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:351" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 351</bibl>; Cels. praef.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Epit. 50, 2</bibl>; cf. the foll. <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> B.; <cit><quote lang="la">and simply, fidem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 23, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratiam nomini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:28:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 28, 29</bibl></cit>, §104: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil universorum juri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 27</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n13318.6" n="B" level="2"> With abstract subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum virtuti, generi, rebus gestis, fidem et auctoritatem in testimonio cupiditatis suspicio derogavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:chapter=7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:102" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 102</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi certam derogat vetustas fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 6, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13318.7" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To disparage, dishonor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et derogastis adversum me verba vostra (i. e. me verbis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:35:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 35, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
derosus: <entryFree id="n13319" type="main" key="de_ro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-rōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [derodo, not in use], <sense id="n13319.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gnawed away, nibbled</hi>: clipeos a muribus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:44:99" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 44, 99</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis a cochleis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 62, § 164</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ficus a locustis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:241" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 25, 38, § 241</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dertona: <entryFree id="n13320" type="main" key="Derto_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dertōna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n13320.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Liguria</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Tortona</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 7, § 49</bibl>; Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 10, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:15" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
deruncino: <entryFree id="n13321" type="main" key="de_runci^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-runcĭno</orth>, no <sense id="n13321.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>runcina</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to plane off;</hi> hence, in the lang. of comedy, <hi rend="ital">to deceive, cheat; to shave</hi> (only in the foll. passages): <cit><quote lang="la">militem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego deruncinatus, deartuatus sum miser,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 108</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
deruo: <entryFree id="n13322" type="main" key="de_ru^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-rŭo</orth>, <itype>rŭi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> (a very rare word). <sense id="n13322.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act., to throw</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cast down</hi>. </sense><sense id="n13322.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiems immensam vim aquarum ruptis nubibus deruat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:27" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13322.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to take away, detract</hi>: cumulum de laudibus alicujus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 11, 2</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n13322.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr., to fall down</hi>: Ap. M. 2, p. 128; 7, p. 196.</sense></entryFree>
derupio: <entryFree id="n13323" type="main" key="de_ru^pi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-rŭpĭo</orth>, v. deripio.</entryFree>
deruptus: <entryFree id="n13324" type="main" key="de_ruptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-ruptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [derumpo, not in use], <sense id="n13324.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">broken;</hi> hence, like abruptus, of localities, <hi rend="ital">precipitous, steep</hi> (not before Lucret.): <cit><quote lang="la">dextra pars (maceriae) in aliquantum altitudinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 15</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">saxa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:539" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 539</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ripae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">angustiae (with praecipites),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collis (with arduus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spatia terrae (with prona),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:2:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 2, 11</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in deruptiorem tumulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> and <pos>adv.</pos> appear not to occur.—</sense><sense id="n13324.1" n="b" level="4"> In <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">dērupta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">precipices</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in derupta praecipitati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per derupta et avia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 21</bibl>. <cb n="DESC" /></sense></entryFree>
desacro: <entryFree id="n13325" type="main" key="de_sa_^cro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-sā^cro</orth> (also written desecro; cf. consecro), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (post-Aug. and rare for the class. consecro), <sense id="n13325.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to consecrate, dedicate</hi>. </sense><sense id="n13325.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">quercum Triviae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:586" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 586</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13325.2" n="B" level="2"> (Acc. to consecro, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> I. B.) Of persons, <hi rend="ital">to deify</hi>, Capitol. Anton. philos. 18.—* </sense><sense id="n13325.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to devote, destine</hi> to any use: <cit><quote lang="la">chamaeleon per singula membra desecratus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>prescribed for particular diseases</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 8, 29, § 112</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
desaevio: <entryFree id="n13326" type="main" key="de_saevi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-saevĭo</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype> (the <sense id="n13326.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pluperfect subj.</hi> contr. desaevisset, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:29" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 29</bibl>), <itype>4</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> </sense><sense id="n13326.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To rave furiously, to rage</hi> (not anteAug., and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">toto Aeneas desaevit in aequore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:569" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 569</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pelago hiems,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes in artus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:540" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 540</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:29" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 29</bibl>: tragica in arte, * <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli Punici procella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:6:12" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ira tua desaeviet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:16:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 16, 22</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n13326.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To cease raving</hi> or <hi rend="ital">raging</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec dum desaeviat ira, Exspectat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:304" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 304</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
desalto: <entryFree id="n13327" type="main" key="de_salto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-salto</orth>, no <sense id="n13327.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, ātum, 1, <hi rend="ital">v. a., to dance through, to represent by dancing</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">desaltato cantico abiit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:54" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 54 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: fabulosas antiquitatum libidines, Cypr. de Spectac. <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></sense></entryFree>
descendens: <entryFree id="n13328" type="main" key="de_scendens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēscendens</orth>, v. descendo, II. B. 3.</entryFree>
descendo: <entryFree id="n13329" type="main" key="de_scendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-scendo</orth>, <itype>di, sum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n13329.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf. redupl.</hi>: descendidit, Valer. Antias ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; and, descendiderant, Laber. ib.; <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>: desciderunt, Inscr. Frat. Arv. 13 Henzen.), <hi rend="ital">v. n., to come down;</hi> and of inanimate subjects, <hi rend="ital">to fall, sink down, to descend</hi>, opp. to ascendo (class. and freq.). </sense><sense id="n13329.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n13329.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ex equo,</quote> <trans><tr>to alight</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 10, 34</bibl></cit>; Auct. B. Hisp. 15, 2; <cit><quote lang="la">for which, equo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Hist. Fragm. 5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> Hist. Fragm. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicut monte descenderat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 50:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 50, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e curru,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e tribunali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de rostris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:chapter=11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de templo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de caelo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 18</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which, caelo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 3, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e caelo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:27" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelo ab alto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:423" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 423</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vertice montis ab alto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 675</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">ab Histro (Da cus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:497" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 497</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab Alpibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:32:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 32, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:38:6" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 38, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">monte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aggeribus Alpinis atque arce Monoeci,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 831</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antro Castalio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per clivum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:263" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 263</bibl></cit> et saep.—Indicating the terminus <hi rend="ital">ad quem</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in mare de caelo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:427" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 427</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juppiter in terras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:402" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 402</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in pon tum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:607" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 607</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:152" default="NO">15, 152</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">caelo in hibernas undas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:235" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 235</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelo ad suos honores templaque, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:551" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 551</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aestum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:402" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 402</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in inferiorem ambulationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:chapter=4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in campos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:737" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 737</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Piraeum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:64" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 64</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad naviculas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 48 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad genitorem imas Erebi descendit ad umbras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:404" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 404</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinus vestis infra genua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 5</bibl></cit> et saep. <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> also with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nocti, i. e. ad inferos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:708" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 708</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Erebo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:759" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 13, 759</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">per quod oraculo utentes sciscitatum deos descendunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:27:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 27, 8</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">turbo descendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:438" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 438</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">asta ut descendam (sc. ex equo),</quote> <trans><tr>dismount, alight</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 120</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">descendens (sc. e lecto),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:5:41" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 5, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">descendo (sc. de arce),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:632" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 632</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbrae descendentes (sc. ad inferos),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:5:41" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 5, 41</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: trepidi quoties nos descendentis arenae vidimus in partes, i. e. <hi rend="ital">that seemed to sink</hi> as the wild beasts rose from the vaults, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:7:69" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 7, 69</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13329.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n13329.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To go down, to go, to come</hi>, sc. from the dwelling-houses (which in Rome were mostly situated on eminences) to the forum, the comitia, etc.: in forum descendens, Crass. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:66:267" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 66, 267</bibl>; so, ad forum, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 538, 26</bibl>; Q. Cic. Petit. cons. 14; Valer. Antias ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:1" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 1</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fuge, quo descendere gestis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 5</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Orell. ad loc.: ad comitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:13 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 13 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de palatio et aedibus suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 46</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">hodie non descendit Antonius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 6, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:27 al" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 27 al.</bibl> —</sense><sense id="n13329.5" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in causam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 8, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in partes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 15, 50</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n13329.6" n="c" level="4"> Of land, etc., <hi rend="ital">to sink, fall, slope</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:538" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 538</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13329.7" n="d" level="4"> Of forests whose wood is brought to the plain, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,003:2:115" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Ach. 2, 115</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caucasus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:55" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 55</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13329.8" n="e" level="4"> Of water conveyed in pipes, <hi rend="ital">to fall</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">subeat descendatque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 6, 31, § 57</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of the sea: non magis descenderet aequor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:338" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 338</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13329.9" n="2" level="3"> In milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">to march down</hi>, sc. from an eminence <pb n="555" /> <cb n="DESC" /> into the plain: <cit><quote lang="la">ex superioribus locis in planitiem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 98</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 65, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qua (sc. de monte),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 50:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 50, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inde (sc. de arce),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 32</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aequum locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:53:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 53, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which, in aequum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in campum omnibus copiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in plana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 2:5:18" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 2, 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Alexandriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 12</bibl></cit> et saep.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 3:17:9" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 3, 17, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad laevam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 55 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 55 al.</bibl></cit>—With <hi rend="ital">supine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedatum in agros Romanos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 10, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:31:2" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 31, 2</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n13329.10" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aciem,</quote> <trans><tr>to go into battle, to engage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:29" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 1:11:11 al" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 1, 11, 11 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in proelium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:ib. 2:1:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:2:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 21, 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in certamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad pugnam, ad tales pugnas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:518" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 518</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:173" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 173</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 2:1:11" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 2, 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:2:5:41" default="NO">2, 5, 41</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and even, in bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:15:4:21" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 15, 4, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:8:1" default="NO">38, 8, 1</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in belli periculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:15:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 15, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13329.11" n="3" level="3"> In medic. lang., of the excrements: <hi rend="ital">to pass off, pass through</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">olera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alvus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 7</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n13329.12" n="4" level="3"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to sink down, penetrate into</hi> any thing (freq. only after the Aug. per.; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic. and Caes.): ferrum in corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 41</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:544" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 544</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">toto descendit in ilia ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(harundo) in caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 216</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in jugulos gladiis descendebant (hostes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:10:13" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 10, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ense in jugulos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Get. 601</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in terram (fulmen),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 55, 56, § 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in rimam calamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 14, 24, § 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subjacens soli duritia non patitur in altum descendere (radices), lapathi radix ad tria cubita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 6, 31, § 98</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">toto corpore pestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:683" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 683</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">galeas vetant descendere cristae,</quote> <trans><tr>to sink down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:262" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 262</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n13329.13" n="5" level="3"> In an obscene sense, Catull. 112, 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:163" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 163</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13329.14" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n13329.15" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (esp. freq. in Quint.), <hi rend="ital">to descend</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">a vita pastorali ad agriculturam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:3 sq" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 3 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:4:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usus in nostram aetatem descendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 11, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(vox) attollitur concitatis affectibus, compositis descendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 65</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:92" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 92</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">grammatici omnes in hanc descendent rerum tenuitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 4, 7</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">in omnia familiaritatis officia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:85:5" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 85, 5</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo contemptionis descensum, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 1</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid tamen olim Scripseris, in Maeci descendat judicis aures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:387" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 387</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si descendere ad ipsum Ordine perpetuo quaeris sunt hujus origo Ilus et Assaracus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:754" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 754</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13329.16" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n13329.17" n="1" level="3"> (Acc. to <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> I. A. 4.) <hi rend="ital">To sink deep into, to penetrate deeply</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod verbum in pectus Jugurthae altius, quam quisquam ratus erat, descendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 11:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 11, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut altius injuriae quam merita descendant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1 praef" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Contr. 1 praef.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Ant. Get. 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cura in animos Patrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 52</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (metus deorum) cum descendere ad animos ... non posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo in sese tentat descendere,</quote> <trans><tr>to examine himself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:4:23" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 4, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13329.18" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To lower one's self, descend to</hi> an act or employment, etc.; <hi rend="ital">to yield, agree to</hi> any act, esp. to one which is unpleasant or wrong (freq. in Cic. and Caes.; cf. Orell. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:chapter=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 2</bibl>, and Fabri ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 14, 3</bibl>).—Constr. with <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>, very rarely with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">senes ad ludum adolescentium descendant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 43</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad calamitatum societates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:17:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 17, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sua voluntate sapientem descendere ad rationes civitatis non solere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:6 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 6 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad ejusmodi consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:29:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 29, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad innocentium supplicia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 16</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad vim atque ad arma,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad gravissimas verborum contumelias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad accusandum, ad inimicitias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:27:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 27, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:41:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 41, 89</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:chapter=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 1</bibl>: ad extrema, Pollio ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:33:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 33, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad frontis urbanae praemia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 9, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">preces in omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:782" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 782</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">videte, quo descendam, judices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:81:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 81, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad intellectum audientis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad minutissima opera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 12, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:15" default="NO">4, 2, 15</bibl>: placet mihi ista defensio; <cit><quote lang="la">descendo,</quote> <trans><tr>I acquiesce</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:ib. 2:2:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 72</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13329.19" n="3" level="3"> (Mostly ante-Aug.) <hi rend="ital">To descend</hi> or <hi rend="ital">proceed from</hi> any person or thing: <cit><quote lang="la">ex gradu ascendentium vel descendentium uxorem ducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:2:68" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 23, 2, 68</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod genus liberalitatis ex jure gentium descendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:26:1" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 43, 26, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:1:57" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 18, 1, 57 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">a Platone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 24, 51, § 111</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 43</bibl>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-scendens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> and <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a descendant;</hi> <cb n="DESC" /> <number>plur.</number> descendentes, <hi rend="ital">posterity</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:2:68" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 23, 2, 68</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n13329.20" n="4" level="3"> (In Quint.) <hi rend="ital">To depart, deviate, differ from</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum ab eo defluebat, quantum ille (sc. Seneca) ab antiquis descenderat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:126" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 126</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:5:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 5, 8</bibl>.!*? The <hi rend="ital">passive</hi> is very rare, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 16, 13, § 71</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 1075</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
descensio: <entryFree id="n13330" type="main" key="de_scensi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēscensĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>descendo</etym> (postAug.), <sense id="n13330.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a going down, descending</hi>. </sense><sense id="n13330.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">balinearum,</quote> <trans><tr>into the bath</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 17, 69, § 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tiberina,</quote> <trans><tr>the sail down the Tiber</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:24:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 24, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grando in descensione saltus,</quote> <trans><tr>upon the thickets</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:32:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 32, 19</bibl></cit>.—Hence, * </sense><sense id="n13330.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the bath itself</hi>, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)mba/seis</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
descensorius: <entryFree id="n13331" type="main" key="de_scenso_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēscensōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>descendo</etym>, <sense id="n13331.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">descending, coming downwards</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">motus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> de Spir. Sanc. 1, 10, 118</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
descensus: <entryFree id="n13332" type="main" key="de_scensus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēscensus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, v. descendo <sense id="n13332.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> !*?.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n13333" type="main" key="de_scensus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēscensus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>descendo</etym>, <sense id="n13333.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a descent</hi> (rare; not in Cic. and Caes.). </sense><sense id="n13333.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">qua illi descensus erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 57:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 57, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13333.2" n="B" level="2"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">a descending way, a descent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">difficilis et praeruptus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:40:4" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 40, 4</bibl></cit> and 5; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">facilis descensus Averno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipso descensu Jovis speluncae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 26, 46, § 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:19:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 19, 37</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n13333.3" n="II" level="1"> In partic. (acc. to descendo, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> I. B. 5), obscene, <hi rend="ital">a lying down</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5:13" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
descindo: <entryFree id="n13334" type="main" key="de_scindo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-scindo</orth>, <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, <sense id="n13334.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to divide</hi>: Sacerdotes clusi succincti libellis acceptis carmen descindentes tripodaverunt, i. e. <hi rend="ital">marking, in singing, the pauses and measure</hi>, Inscr. Frat. Arv. 41. (Henz.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina divides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:15:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 1, 15, 15</bibl></cit>; acc. to others, <hi rend="ital">absol., parting, dividing into two parties</hi>, v. Wordsworth, Fragm. and Specim. p. 391.)</sense></entryFree>
descisco: <entryFree id="n13335" type="main" key="de_scisco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-scisco</orth>, <itype>īvi or ĭi, ītum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, orig. a publicist's t. t. <sense id="n13335.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to free one's self</hi> from a connection with any one, <hi rend="ital">to withdraw, leave, revolt from</hi>, = sciscendo deficere; and with an indication of the terminus, <hi rend="ital">to desert to, go over to</hi> any one (class. prose). </sense><sense id="n13335.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">multae longinquiores civitates ab Afranio desciscunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 60 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ab aliquo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 32, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 9, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,007:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alc. 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dat. 5, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 5, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad aliquem (opp. a nobis deficere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Praeneste ab Latinis ad Romanos descivit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 19</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and simply: ad aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 4:3:14 al" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 4, 3, 14 al.</bibl>; cf. <hi rend="ital">pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus invitis descitum ad Samnites erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 16</bibl></cit>; and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:5:6" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 5, 6</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Fidenae aperte descissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:19" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:68" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Tim. 3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Tim. 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,022:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ham. 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 1:8:6" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 1, 8, 6</bibl>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:311 al" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 311 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n13335.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> beyond the political sphere, <hi rend="ital">to depart, deviate, withdraw from</hi> a person or thing; <hi rend="ital">to fall off from, be unfaithful to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a nobis desciscere quaeres?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a se ipse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si Cicero a Demosthene paulum in hac parte descivit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:146" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur Zeno ab hac antiqua institutione desciverit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 8</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">a pristina causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 17</bibl></cit> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a veritate,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a natura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a disciplina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:81" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a virtute,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a consuetudine parentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 20, 4</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">a vita,</quote> <trans><tr>to separate, sever one's self</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:18:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 18, 61</bibl></cit> (opp. manere in vita).—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecipiti cursu a virtute descitum, ad vitia transcursum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 1</bibl></cit>.—Stating the terminus, <hi rend="ital">to fall off to, decline to; to degenerate into</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab excitata fortuna ad inclinatam et prope jacentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 16</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad saevitiam, ad cupiditatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 10</bibl></cit>: in regem (i. e. <hi rend="ital">to degenerate, be transformed</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:3" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in monstrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13335.3" n="B" level="2"> Of subjects not personal: <cit><quote lang="la">quis ignorat et eloquentiam et ceteras artes descivisse ab ista vetere gloria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(vitis) gracili arvo non desciscit,</quote> <trans><tr>does not degenerate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:10:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 10, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
descobino: <entryFree id="n13336" type="main" key="de_sco^bi_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-scŏbīno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>scobina</etym>, <sense id="n13336.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to file</hi> or <hi rend="ital">scrape off</hi> (ante- and postclass., and very rare): supercilia, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 492, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 99, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, p. 200</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
describo: <entryFree id="n13337" type="main" key="de_scri_bo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-scrībo</orth>, <itype>psi, ptum</itype> (in MSS. and edd. often confounded with discribo, q. v.), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n13337.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To copy off, transcribe</hi> any thing from an original (freq. in Cic.; <cit><quote lang="la">elsewh. rare): scripsit Balbus ad me, se a te (i. e. e tuo exemplo) quintum de Finibus librum descripsisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 4, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistolam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 17</bibl>, <cb n="DESC" /> 2; <cit><quote lang="la">12, 7, 22: legem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Cal. 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 20</bibl>; so, <hi rend="ital">to write down, write out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina in foliis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:445" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 445</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">in carved letters: in viridi cortice carmina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 5, 14</bibl></cit>.— Class. and far more freq., </sense><sense id="n13337.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To sketch off, to describe in painting, writing</hi>, etc.: delineare, definire. </sense><sense id="n13337.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">non potuit pictor rectius describere ejus formam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 3, 22</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">geometricas formas in harena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formas in pulvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 31</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:32:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 32, 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:14:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 14, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sphaeram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 14</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeli meatus radio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:851" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 851</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 3, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam votivā tabellā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 33</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n13337.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n13337.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To represent, delineate, describe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">malos mores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 165</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum sermones moresque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:40:138" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 40, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">definienda res erit verbis et breviter describenda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 8</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qualem (mulierem) ego paulo ante descripsi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:20:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 20, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:chapter=29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">me latronem ac sicarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:18:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 18, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis erat dignus describi, quod malus ac fur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malo carmine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 154</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:4:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 4, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnera Parthi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucum, aram Dianae, flumen Rhenum, pluvium arcum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 18</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">praecepta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 3, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facta versibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:18:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 18, 6</bibl></cit>. —Rarely </sense><sense id="n13337.5" n="(b)" level="5"> with <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec qui descripsit corrumpi semina matrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:415" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 415</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 1</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Part. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēscrip-ta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>: <cit><quote lang="la">recitari factorum dictorumque ejus descripta per dies jussit,</quote> <trans><tr>the diary</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13337.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To mark off, define, divide, distribute</hi> into parts. (But whenever the notion of distribution or division is implied, the form discribo seems to have been used by class. writers; and is now restored where de-scr. is found in earlier edd., e.g. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:71:288" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 71, 288</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:30:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 30, 66</bibl> et saep.) Cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">libertinos in quatuor urbanas tribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annum in duodecim menses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:2:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 2, 2</bibl>. —Without <hi rend="ital">in.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">commode omnes descripti, aetates, classes, equitatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:4:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 4, 2</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">classes centuriasque et hunc ordinem ex censu descripsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,006:18:6 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jos. 18, 6 al.</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n13337.7" n="3" level="3"> Aliquid (alicui), <hi rend="ital">to ascribe, apportion, appoint, assign</hi> to any one (cf. remark, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 2 supra); cf.: vecturas frumenti finitimis civitatibus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:42:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 42, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:32 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 32 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">officia,</quote> <trans><tr>to define</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vices (poetae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munera pugnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:267" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 267</bibl></cit> et saep.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēscrip-tus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, qs. marked out, i. e. <hi rend="ital">precisely ordered, properly arranged</hi> (ap. Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">materies orationis omnibus locis descripta, instructa ornataque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:34:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 34, 145</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ordo verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:59:200" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 59, 200</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura nihil est aptius, nihil descriptius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:22:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 22, 74</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Neutr. plur.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēscrip-ta</orth>, <itype>orum</itype>, <hi rend="ital">things recorded, writings</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 24</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> does not occur.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-scriptē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">distinctly, precisely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">descripte et electe digerere, opp. confuse et permixte dispergere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:30:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 30, 49</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
descriptio: <entryFree id="n13338" type="main" key="de_scripti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēscriptĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype> (in MSS. and edd. often confounded with discriptio, <sense id="n13338.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>describo</etym> (freq. in Cic.), <hi rend="ital">a marking out, delineation, copy, transcript</hi>: in concreto. </sense><sense id="n13338.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">eadem caeli descriptio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 22</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">explicate descriptionem imaginemque tabularum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 77 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">numeris aut descriptionibus aliquid explicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volutarum,</quote> <trans><tr>sketches, drawings</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orbis terrarum,</quote> <trans><tr>maps</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 2</bibl></cit> et saep. —Far more freq., </sense><sense id="n13338.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n13338.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A representation, delineation, description</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nominis brevis et aperta descriptio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dilucida locorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:44" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:3:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Siciliae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:164" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 164</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convivii luxuriosi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 66</bibl></cit> et saep.—In rhetor., <hi rend="ital">the delineating of character</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:22:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 22, 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:53:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 53, 205</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 31</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 39, 51</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13338.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A proper disposition, order, arrangement</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">via descriptionis atque ordinis (in oratione),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 9, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedificandi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 39</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">legionum et auxiliorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">descriptio centuriarum classiumque non erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:24:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Reg. 24, 9</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">descriptiones temporum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 3, 19</bibl></cit> et saep. (Descriptio is often found in MSS. and edd. in the sense of <hi rend="ital">distribution, division;</hi> but here the proper form is discriptio,<pb n="556" /> <cb n="DESE" />  e. g. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Off. 1, 7, 21</bibl> saep.)</sense></entryFree>
descriptiuncula: <entryFree id="n13339" type="main" key="de_scripti^uncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēscriptĭuncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>descriptio</etym>, <sense id="n13339.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a short description, delineation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">celebres subtexere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Suas. 2:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Suas. 2, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
descriptivus: <entryFree id="n13340" type="main" key="de_scripti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēscriptīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n13340.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., containing an exact description</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">definitio, Boëth. defin. p. 65: loci communes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fortun.</author> Art. Rhet. 3, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
descriptor: <entryFree id="n13341" type="main" key="de_scriptor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēscriptor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>describo</etym>, <sense id="n13341.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a describer, delineator</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">morum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 9, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">descriptores gentium,</quote> <trans><tr>ethnographers</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 6, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
descriptus: <entryFree id="n13342" type="main" key="de_scriptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēscriptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from describo.</entryFree>
descrobo: <entryFree id="n13343" type="main" key="de_scro^bo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-scrŏbo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>scrobs</etym>, <sense id="n13343.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to set, enchase</hi> (late Lat.): gemmas auro, Tert. Res. carn. 7.</sense></entryFree>
desculpo: <entryFree id="n13344" type="main" key="de_sculpo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-sculpo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n13344.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to carve out, to copy by carving</hi> or <hi rend="ital">graving</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">simulacrum ligno,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Nat. 1, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
desecatio: <entryFree id="n13345" type="main" key="de_se^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēsĕcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n13345.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cutting off</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ramorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> in Psa. 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unus ensis, sed duas desecationes habet,</quote> <trans><tr>edges</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 149, 7</bibl></cit>. From</sense></entryFree>
deseco: <entryFree id="n13346" type="main" key="de_se^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-sĕco</orth>, <itype>cŭi, ctum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n13346.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to cut off, cut away</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">vitem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:41:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 41, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partes ex toto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uvas a vite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:43:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 43, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">segetes et prata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spicas fascibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 64</bibl></cit>: particulam undique, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:16:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 1, 16, 15</bibl>; and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa metallis,</quote> <trans><tr>to carve out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:2:85" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 2, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hordeum, pabulum, herbas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:58:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 58, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">segetem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B.
