G. 7, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">cervicem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spicas fascibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 34</bibl></cit>: collum, *<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:438" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 438</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13346.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu illud (prooemium) desecabis, hos agglutinabis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
desecro: <entryFree id="n13347" type="main" key="de_se_^cro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēsē^cro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. desacro.</entryFree>
desectio: <entryFree id="n13348" type="main" key="de_secti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēsectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>deseco</etym>, <sense id="n13348.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cutting off</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stramentorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:3:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 3, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
desenesco: <entryFree id="n13349" type="hapax" key="de_se^nesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-sĕnesco</orth>, <itype>nŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n13349.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to diminish by age, to die away</hi>: ira belli desenuit, Sall. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 887</bibl> P. (Hist. 1, 93 Dietsch).</sense></entryFree>
deseps: <entryFree id="n13350" type="main" key="de_seps"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēseps</orth>, <itype>sĭpis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>de - sapio</etym>, <sense id="n13350.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">out of one's mind, insane</hi>, Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:233" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 233</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
desero: <entryFree id="n13351" type="main" key="de_se^ro1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-sĕro</orth>, no <sense id="n13351.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, sĭtum, 3, <hi rend="ital">v. a., to sow, plant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">desitis seminibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:23:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 23, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n13352" type="main" key="de_se^ro2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-sĕro</orth>, <itype>rŭi, rtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <sense id="n13352.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to undo</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sever</hi> one's connection with another; hence, with esp. reference to the latter, <hi rend="ital">to leave, forsake, abandon, desert, give up</hi> (cf. derelinquere; more restricted in signif. than relinquere, which denotes, in general, to depart from, to leave any one. Deserere, orig. in milit. lang., implies a cowardly running away; frequently used with prodere; also in the flg. phrase: deserere vitam; and later, <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> in the sense of <hi rend="ital">to desert</hi>, etc.; cf. also: linquere, destituere, deficere, discedere—freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n13352.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n13352.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut jurent omnes, se exercitum ducesque non deserturos neque prodituros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:76:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 76, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 32, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deseritur a suis Varus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 13, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 15, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:3:6 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 5, 3, 6 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pignus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 75</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">te amantem non deseram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 101</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:8:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 8, 53</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum amici partim deseruerint me, partim etiam prodiderint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me deseruisti ac dereliquisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 5, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 51</bibl>, and <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr>: <cit><quote lang="la">Avaricum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:30:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 30, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cunctis oppidis castellisque desertis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fratrem ne desere frater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:600" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 600</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">thalamos ne desere pactos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 649</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:2:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 5, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victoriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:3:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites insepultos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:13:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">metu locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 65</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n13352.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, in milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">to desert</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 5, 1</bibl>; Sen. de Ira, 2, 10, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:85" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 85</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> Marc. 31, 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:16:3:section=7 sq" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 16, 3, § 7 sq.</bibl> al.—</sense><sense id="n13352.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to leave, desert, abandon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Petreius non deserit sese, armat familiam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:75:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 75, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suum jus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:chapter=35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 35 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">desertarum derelictarumque rerum patrocinium suscipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:5:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">preces, promissa, spem, obsecrationem et fideles litteras alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 3, 19, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:20:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 20, 58</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">desertam ac proditam causam queri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ullam officii partem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:7:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 7, 24</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">officium (with praetermittere defensionem),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 9</bibl></cit>: susceptum officium, <cb n="DESE" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 20, 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deditionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 70:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 70, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studia sapientiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viam virtutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:24:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 3, 24, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestigia Graeca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:287" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 287</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fastidiosam copiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Od. 3, 29, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13352.5" n="2" level="3"> Esp., leg. t. t.: <cit><quote lang="la">vadimonia deserere,</quote> <trans><tr>to forfeit recognizance, fail to appear</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 3, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 23, 75</bibl> et saep.—So <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deserui, tempestatibus impeditus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:78" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 78</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13352.6" n="B" level="2"> Of subjects not personal, <hi rend="ital">to fail, forsake</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">genua hunc cursorem deserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem corpus, vires,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">donec te deseret aetas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me lucerna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama Curium Fabricium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:46:section=110" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 46, § 110</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec facundia deseret hunc nec lucidus ordo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 41</bibl></cit> et saep.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensa deserit toros,</quote> <trans><tr>is removed from</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 12, 52</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deseremur potius a re familiari, quam a republica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:34:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 34, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">a tribunitia voce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:40:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 40, 110</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:80" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:4:29 al" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 4, 29 al.</bibl>; and <usg type="style">poet.</usg> with simple <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">deseror conjuge,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 12, 161</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:7:17" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 7, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">desertus viribus leo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 21, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:707" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 707</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Cal. 12</bibl>.— With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deserta natorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:608" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 608</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēsertus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., deserted;</hi> esp. of places, <hi rend="ital">desert, solitary, waste</hi>. </sense><sense id="n13352.7" n="A" level="2"> <pos>Adj.</pos> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vastus, inanis, solitarius): in locis desertis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:53:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 53, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbes dirutae ac pene desertae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deserta via et inculta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:chapter=18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frequens an desertus locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:37" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:26:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 26, 33</bibl></cit> et saep.—Of objects in solitary places: <cit><quote lang="la">stipes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:1:12" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 1, 12</bibl></cit> (21 M.): <cit><quote lang="la">arbores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:20:36" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 20, 36</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-serta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the abandoned wife</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multi filii desertae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,009:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gal. 4, 27</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">reditus desertior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:23:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 23, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil turpius ac desertius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 5</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">orae desertissimae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:22:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 22, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:67 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 67 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n13352.8" n="B" level="2"> Since the Aug. per. <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēserta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">desert places, deserts, wastes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:342" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 342</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:26 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 4, 4, § 26 al.</bibl>—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Libyae deserta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:384" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 384</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:291" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 291</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 1:7:7" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 1, 7, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:52:9 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 52, 9 al.</bibl>—In <number>sing.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēsertum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">in deserto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 774</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 125, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 2</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
deserpo: <entryFree id="n13353" type="main" key="de_serpo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-serpo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n13353.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to creep down</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">genis lanugo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:586" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 586</bibl></cit>; cf. Ap. Mag. p. 315.</sense></entryFree>
desertio: <entryFree id="n13354" type="main" key="de_serti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēsertĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. desero</etym>, <sense id="n13354.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a forsaking, deserting</hi> (rare; perh. not ante-Aug.).— <usg type="dom">Milit. t. t.</usg> (acc. to 2. desero, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> I. B.), <hi rend="ital">desertion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">peccatum desertionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:16:3:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 16, 3, § 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:section=2 al" default="NO">5, § 2 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
desertor: <entryFree id="n13355" type="main" key="de_sertor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēsertor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n13355.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who forsakes, abandons, deserts</hi> any one.—</sense><sense id="n13355.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. </sense><sense id="n13355.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">amicorum (opp. conservator inimicorum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">communis utilitatis aut salutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:19:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 19, 64</bibl></cit>.—Esp. freq., </sense><sense id="n13355.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="dom">Milit. t. t.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a runaway, deserter</hi> (opp. transfuga, <hi rend="ital">one who joins the enemy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:16:5:section=8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 16, 5, § 8</bibl>), * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:23:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 23, 8</bibl> (with proditor, as in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 72</bibl>); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:69:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 69, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:18:16" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 18, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:85" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:119" default="NO">119</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:52" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:68" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 4:1:29" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 4, 1, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:16:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 16, 3 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl> al. et saep.—</sense><sense id="n13355.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> beyond the milit. sphere, <hi rend="ital">a deserter, one who abandons</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Amoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:19:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 19, 157</bibl></cit>: Asiae, *<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13355.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">usus corporis desertor animi,</quote> <trans><tr>a forsaker</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:739" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 739</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
desertrix: <entryFree id="n13356" type="hapax" key="de_sertrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēsertrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>desertor</etym>, <sense id="n13356.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that forsakes, neglects</hi>: divinae legis, Tert. de hab. mulier. 1.</sense></entryFree>
desertum: <entryFree id="n13357" type="main" key="de_sertum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēsertum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. <itype>desero</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> B.</entryFree>
desertus: <entryFree id="n13358" type="main" key="de_sertus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēsertus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from desero.</entryFree>
deservio: <entryFree id="n13359" type="main" key="de_servi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-servĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <sense id="n13359.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to serve zealously, be devoted to, subject to</hi> (rare, but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">valetudini tuae, dum mihi deservis, servisti non satis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuivis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:30:109" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 30, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:chapter=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grammatico soli deserviamus, deinde geometrae?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 12, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Epicurei) sibi indulgentes et corpori deservientes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:13:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 13, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:77:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pan. 77, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Deo meo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:24:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 24, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13359.1" n="B" level="2"> Of subjects not personal: <cit><quote lang="la">si officia, si operae, si vigiliae deserviunt amicis, praesto sunt omnibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:chapter=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 9</bibl></cit>: nec unius oculis<cb n="DESI" />  flumina, fontes, maria deserviunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:50:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 50, 1</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quoddam deserviens his (sc. oculis) ministerium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:77" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 77</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
deses: <entryFree id="n13360" type="main" key="de_ses"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēses</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype> (<sense id="n13360.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nom. sing.</hi> appears not to occur), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>desideo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">inactive, indolent, idle</hi> (syn.: iners, segnis, piger, ignavus, socors, tardus—rare, perh. not ante-Aug., nor in Aug. poets). </sense><sense id="n13360.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">sedemus desides domi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 68</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of persons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:1:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">longa pace desides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 88</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> (with ignavus); with <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">desidem ab opere suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:12:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 12, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13360.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> of inanimate things: <cit><quote lang="la">nec rem Romanam tam desidem umquam fuisse atque imbellem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naturā deside torpet orbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:436" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 436</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">desidis otia vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:5:85" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 5, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causae desidis anni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deside passu Ire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deside cura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:147" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Th. 6, 147</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 87</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
desicco: <entryFree id="n13361" type="main" key="de_sicco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-sicco</orth>, no <sense id="n13361.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, ātum, 1, <hi rend="ital">v. a., to dry up, to desiccate</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">vasa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 48, 900</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
desideo: <entryFree id="n13362" type="main" key="de_si^de^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-sĭdĕo</orth>, <itype>sēdi, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>sedeo</etym>, <sense id="n13362.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to remain</hi> or <hi rend="ital">continue sitting, to sit long;</hi> and with the accessory idea of inactivity, <hi rend="ital">to sit idle, to remain inactive</hi> (rare; not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n13362.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">tam diu Ibi desidere neque redire filium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Bac. 2, 3, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 4, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">frustra ibi totum desedi diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquila ramis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 4, 21</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">amoenioribus locis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:8:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud Nicomedem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aliquo spectaculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in discrimine sociorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13362.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to go to stool</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 12</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 4, 18.</sense></entryFree>
desiderabilis: <entryFree id="n13363" type="main" key="de_si_de^ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēsīdĕrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>desidero</etym>, <sense id="n13363.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">desirable</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">desiderabilia (anteponantur) iis, quibus facile carere possis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:18:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 18, 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:16:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 16, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">velut suis vitiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">princeps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:105:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 105, 24</bibl></cit>; and in the <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 21</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> does not occur.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēsī-dĕrābĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">with ardent desire</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">concupiscere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 143:2" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 143, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
desiderans: <entryFree id="n13364" type="main" key="de_si_de^rans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēsīdĕrans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, v. <itype>desidero</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> 1.</entryFree>
desideranter: <entryFree id="n13365" type="main" key="de_si_de^ranter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēsīdĕranter</orth>, <sense id="n13365.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv., eagerly</hi>, v. <itype>desidero</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
desideratio: <entryFree id="n13366" type="main" key="de_si_de^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēsīdĕrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>desidero</etym>, <sense id="n13366.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a desiring, longing for</hi> any thing; <hi rend="ital">a missing</hi> (rare): voluptatum, * <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 14, 47</bibl>; <number>plur.</number> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8 praef.</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n13366.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The question to be examined</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">relinquetur desideratio, quid, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 6, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
desiderativus: <entryFree id="n13367" type="main" key="de_si_de^ra_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēsīdĕrātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, in the late gram. lang. <sense id="n13367.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">desiderative</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba (e. g. esurio, coenaturio, etc.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:page=2006" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> p. 2006</bibl></cit> P.</sense></entryFree>
desideratus: <entryFree id="n13368" type="main" key="de_si_de^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēsīdĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. <itype>desidero</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> 2.</entryFree>
desiderium: <entryFree id="n13369" type="main" key="de_si_de^ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēsīdĕrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>desidero</etym>, <sense id="n13369.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a longing, ardent desire</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wish</hi>, properly for something once possessed; <hi rend="ital">grief, regret</hi> for the absence or loss of any thing (for syn. cf.: optio, optatio, cupido, cupiditas, studium, appetitio, voluntas—freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n13369.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. </sense><sense id="n13369.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen. object.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">te desiderium Athenarum cepisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">me desiderium tenet urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 22</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and, locorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:2:21" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum earum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:901" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 901</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:922" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 922</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:918" default="NO" valid="yes">918</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse in desiderio alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">desiderium conjunctissimi viri ferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:27:104" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 27, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scipionis desiderio moveri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam cari capitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 1, 24, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">defuncti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 6</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">desiderio id fieri tuo (for tui),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 66</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">voluntas, in qua inest aliqua vis desiderii ad sanandum volnus injuriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 4, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13369.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: pectora dura tenet desiderium, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui esse magno desiderio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">explere exspectationem diuturni desiderii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:47:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 47, 205</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo (desiderio) conficior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex desiderio laborare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere aliquid cum desiderio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:21:81" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 21, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">demus hoc desiderio jam pene publico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:4:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 4, 29</bibl></cit> et saep. In <number>plur.</number>: desideria alicujus commovere, Cic. Rab. perd. 9, 24; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 4, 5, 15</bibl> et saep. </sense><sense id="n13369.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of a person, as the object of longing: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc desiderium, curaque non levis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:14:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 1, 14, 18</bibl></cit>: desiderio meo nitenti, Catull. 2, 5; <cit><quote lang="la">and as a term of endearment: mea lux, meum desiderium ... valete, mea desideria, valete,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 2, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; Catull. 2, 5.— </sense><sense id="n13369.5" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n13369.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Want, need, necessity</hi>, <pb n="557" /> <cb n="DESI" /> in general (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not ante-Aug.): cibi potionisque desiderium naturale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 4</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">pro desiderio corporum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:264" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 50, 111, § 264</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">desideria scabendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:127 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 14, 43, § 127 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n13369.7" n="B" level="2"> In the time of the empire, <hi rend="ital">a request, petition</hi> on the part of inferiors: <cit><quote lang="la">desideria militum ad Caesarem ferenda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:79:6" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 79, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:16:9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 16, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:25:3:5" default="NO">25, 3, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13369.8" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Desires, pleasures</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">servientibus desideriis et voluptatibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,017:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Tit. 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carnis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ephes. 2, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
desidero: <entryFree id="n13370" type="main" key="de_si_de^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-sīdĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>etym. dub.; cf. considero</etym>, <sense id="n13370.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to long for, greatly wish for, to desire</hi> something not possessed (freq. and class.—for syn. cf.: opto, requiro, expeto, appeto, affecto, cupio, concupisco, aveo, gestio, capto, volo). </sense><sense id="n13370.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., with <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dies noctesque me ames, me desideres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam tu filium tuom, tam pater me meus desiderat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura quid velit, anquirat, desideret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec sitio honores, nec desidero gloriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum illa desideramus, ab aliis avertimur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:6:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid desideremus aut deprecemur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 1, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec nunc vires desidero adolescentis non plus quam adolescens tauri aut elephanti desiderabam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:74:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 74, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">desiderantem quod satis est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 3, 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sextilem totum mendax desideror,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 2</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n13370.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">me gratiam aps te inire verbis nil desidero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 4, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi dari haud desidero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo ullam rem ad se importari desiderent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 2</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> alone: <cit><quote lang="la">mori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Apoc. 9, 6</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n13370.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab Chrysippo nihil magnum desideravi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 14, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:1:2 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 1, 2 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab milite modestiam et continentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 52 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quo (Catone) summam eloquentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:31:118" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 31, 118</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:5:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 5, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 8, 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:22:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 22, 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:55 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 2, 55 al.</bibl>— </sense><sense id="n13370.4" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">misere amans desiderat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 2, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:6:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 6, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:16 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 16 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n13370.5" n="B" level="2"> Of inanimate subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">desiderarunt te oculi mei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullam virtus aliam mercedem laborum desiderat praeter, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:11:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 11, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut desiderat laus probationem, sic, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 7, 4</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">desiderant rigari arbores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 26, 40, § 249</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n13370.6" n="II" level="1"> With predominant idea of lacking, wanting, <hi rend="ital">to miss</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">ex me audies, quid in oratione tua desiderem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si non est, nolis esse neque desideres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:8:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 8, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid a peritioribus rei militaris desiderari videbatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:61:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 61, 3</bibl></cit> et saep.—Esp. with quominus: <cit><quote lang="la">praeter quercum Dodonaeam nihil desideramus, quo minus Epirum ipsum possidere videamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 4, 5</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n13370.7" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> <hi rend="ital">(effectus pro causa), to lose</hi> something; and more freq. pass., <hi rend="ital">to be missing, to be lost</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eo proelio non amplius CC milites desideravit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 99</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nulla navis desideraretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 5, 23, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 11, 8</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">neque quicquam ex fano praeter unum signum desideratum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:52:6" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 52, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex peditibus triginta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:29:27" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 29, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13370.8" n="C" level="2"> With the notion of inquiring, searching; <hi rend="ital">to investigate, examine, discuss</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">sequitur ut morbo laborantibus remedia desiderentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:13:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">examina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:8:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 8, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">antequam desideraretur,</quote> <trans><tr>before the question should be raised</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 6, 4</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n13370.9" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēsīdĕrans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, in <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> desiderantissimus, in the later writers for desideratissimus, as a term of endearment, <hi rend="ital">heart's desire, best beloved</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vale, domine dulcissime, desiderantissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:Ep. 5:40" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author> Ep. 5, 40</bibl></cit>; M. Aur. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:1:5" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 1, 5</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">L. Aur. Verus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:2:8" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4644</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēsīdĕranter</orth>, acc. to <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> I., <hi rend="ital">with desire, eagerly</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">appetere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 1, 4</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanto desiderantius desideras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:Ep. ad Ver. Imp. 13" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author> Ep. ad Ver. Imp. 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13370.10" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēsīdĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., wished for, longed for, welcome</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">et veniet desideratus cunctis gentibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Aggaei, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: blandissima et desideratissimi promissa. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 1, 1, § 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fratres desideratissimi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Philip. 4, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and in inscrr. applied to a beloved person: FILIO DESIDERATISSIMO,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 5068</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Grut. 681, 2 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
desidia: <entryFree id="n13371" type="main" key="de_si^di^a1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēsĭdĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>desideo</etym>, <sense id="n13371.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sitting</hi> <cb n="DESI" /> <hi rend="ital">long, remaining</hi> in a place. </sense><sense id="n13371.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. (rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:15:6" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 15, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13371.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A sitting idle, idleness, inactivity, slothfulness</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">for syn. cf.: inertia, languor, otium, pax, feriae, justitium, dies fasti, etc., and v. deses): in portum confugere non inertiae neque desidiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:2:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 2, 8</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with inertia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 10, 22</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">with languor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:34:123" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 34, 123</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:27:78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 27, 78</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">with socordia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 4, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">with segnities,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 9</bibl></cit> et saep.; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. industria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 48 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. agentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 149</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">corde expelle desidiam tuo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: latrocinia desidiae minuendae causa fieri, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:23:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 23, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">horridus alter (ductor apium) desidiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitanda est improba Siren, Desidia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 15</bibl></cit> et saep.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 48</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vobis desidiae cordi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:615" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 615</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13371.3" n="B" level="2"> Of an inanimate subject: <cit><quote lang="la">ager post longam desidiam laetas segetes affert,</quote> <trans><tr>lying fallow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:17:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 17, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n13372" type="main" key="de_si_di^a2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēsīdĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>desido</etym>, <sense id="n13372.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a subsiding, retiring</hi> (an Appuleian word): <cit><quote lang="la">maris, Ap. de Mundo, p. 73, 28: sanguinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Dogm. Plat. p. 17:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dogm. Plat. p. 17, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
desidiabulum: <entryFree id="n13373" type="hapax" key="de_si^di^a_bu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēsĭdĭābŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>1. desidia</etym>, <sense id="n13373.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lounging-place</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Bac. 3, 1, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
desidies: <entryFree id="n13374" type="main" key="de_si^di^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēsĭdĭes</orth>, <itype>ei</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> ( = 1. desidia, <sense id="n13374.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II.), <hi rend="ital">idleness</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 49</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
desidiose: <entryFree id="n13375" type="main" key="de_si^di^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēsĭdĭōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n13375.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr>, <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
desidiosus: <entryFree id="n13376" type="main" key="de_si^di^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēsĭdĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>desidia</etym>, qs. full of idleness, i. e. <sense id="n13376.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">slothful, indolent, lazy</hi> (for syn. cf.: piger, segnis, iners, deses, ignavus, socors, lentus, tardus, otiosus). </sense><sense id="n13376.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">qui in oppido sederent quam qui rura colerent, desidiosiores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">praef.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si comparer illi, sum desidiosissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 5, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:1:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">desidiosior in professione grammatica habebatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gramm. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui nolet fieri desidiosus, amet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:9:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 9, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:288" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 288</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13376.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">causing idleness, making lazy</hi>: si quod facit, ab eo (nominetur) quod fit, ut cum <hi rend="ital">desidiosam</hi> artem dicemus, quia <hi rend="ital">desidiosos</hi> facit, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 32, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">habet etiam amoenitas ipsa vel sumptuosas vel desidiosas illecebras multas cupiditatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delectatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:23:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 23, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inertissimum et desidiosissimum otium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">desidiose puer (sc. Cupido),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 92</bibl></cit>.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēsĭdĭōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">idly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">agere aetatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1136</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
desido: <entryFree id="n13377" type="main" key="de_si_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-sīdo</orth>, <itype>sēdi</itype> (de-sīdi, Cic. l. l. infra, Lampr<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:Alex. Sev. 39:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Alex. Sev. 39, 7</bibl>), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, v. consido. —Of inanimate things, esp. of places, <sense id="n13377.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sink, fall</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">settle down</hi>. </sense><sense id="n13377.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">tantos terrae motus factos esse, ut multa oppida corruerint, multis locis labes factae sint terraeque desiderint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 35 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 43, 97</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 9</bibl>; and <usg type="style">poet.</usg> of the apparent sinking of mountains to one flying aloft: <cit><quote lang="la">Gargara desidunt surgenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:549" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 549</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ovum inane natat, plenum desidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:9:11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 9, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:1:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 4, 1, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex urina quod desidit album est,</quote> <trans><tr>sediment</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumor ex toto desidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 18</bibl></cit>. —* </sense><sense id="n13377.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to deteriorate, degenerate</hi>: desidentes mores, Liv. prooem. 9.</sense></entryFree>
desiduo: <entryFree id="n13378" type="hapax" key="de_si_du^o_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēsīdŭō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, "dicitur diuturne," <sense id="n13378.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a long time</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> p. 565, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
designate: <entryFree id="n13379" type="main" key="de_signa_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēsignātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>designo</etym>, <sense id="n13379.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">distinctly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 5</bibl> inscr.</sense></entryFree>
designatio: <entryFree id="n13380" type="main" key="de_signa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēsignātĭo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">dissignātio</orth> (the latter form better in sense II. Brambach <sense id="n13380.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">s. v.</hi> Lex Jul. Munic. ap. Corp. Inscr. Lat. p. 206), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. </sense><sense id="n13380.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A marking out, describing, designating</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cellarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">undarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadrata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a specification</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">personarum et temporum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:31:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 31, 138</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 15, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13380.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A disposition, arrangement</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">totius operis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">librorum meorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 46</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13380.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The selection, designation</hi> to a public office; <hi rend="ital">of consuls</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">annua designatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 36 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
designator: <entryFree id="n13381" type="main" key="de_signa_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēsignātor</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">dissignātor</orth> (the latter form freq. in inscrr., and preferred by Brambach; so Keller, ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 5</bibl>; Corp. Inscr. Lat. pp. 597, 768), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n13381.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who regulates</hi> or <hi rend="ital">arranges; a regulator</hi>.—As a t. t., </sense><sense id="n13381.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An officer whose duty it was to assign seats in the theatre</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. prol. 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13381.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A master of ceremonies at funerals; an undertaker</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:38" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 6, 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spectac. 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 934</bibl>; cf. Don. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 2, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13381.3" n="III" level="1"> <cb n="DESI" /> <hi rend="ital">An umpire at public spectacles</hi>, i. q. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">brabeuth/s</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:2:4:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 2, 4, § 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 3, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
designo: <entryFree id="n13382" type="main" key="de_signo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-signo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">dissigno</orth> (the latter form preferred by Brambach in sense II. B. 2. infra; so Keller, ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 16</bibl>; cf. Roby, L. G. 2, p. 384), āvi, ātum, 1, <sense id="n13382.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to mark out, trace out</hi> (freq. in the Aug. per.); <hi rend="ital">to describe, designate, define</hi> (for syn. cf.: nomino, appello; voco, dico; facio, coöpto, evoco, prodo, declaro, renuntio, seligo). </sense><sense id="n13382.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aeneas urbem designat aratro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:755" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 755</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">moenia fossā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moenia sulco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:825" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 825</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidum sulco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 24</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">finis templo Jovis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">locum circo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 35</bibl></cit>:—vulnere frontem, <hi rend="ital">to mark</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:782" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 782</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nubila ingenti gyro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 311</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n13382.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to delineate, design, depict, represent</hi>, sc. by embroidering, weaving, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">Europen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 103</bibl></cit>.—Far more freq., </sense><sense id="n13382.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n13382.4" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to point out, mark, denote</hi> by <hi rend="ital">speech; to designate, describe, represent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec ab hominibus callidis animadversa ac notata, verbis designata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:23:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 23, 109</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">affectus velut primis lineis designare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:120" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 120</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem aliqua oratione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">notat et designat oculis ad caedem unumquemque nostrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem digito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 1, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 6, 77</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">decumam ex praeda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem nota ignaviae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turpitudinem aliquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:58:236" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 58, 236</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem (mundum) alio loco ipse designarit deum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:13:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 13, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa, quae nimiam luxuriam et victoriae fiduciam designarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 96</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n13382.5" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n13382.6" n="1" level="3"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">to contrive, devise, perpetrate</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">exsequi, patrare, perpetrare—very rare): quae designata sint et facta nequitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 1, 66</bibl></cit>; cf.: Illa, quae antehac facta sunt, Omitto; <cit><quote lang="la">modo quid designavit!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 2, 7</bibl></cit> Donat.—In a good sense: <cit><quote lang="la">quid non ebrietas designat,</quote> <trans><tr>effect, do, accomplish</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 16</bibl></cit> Orell.—</sense><sense id="n13382.7" n="2" level="3"> With access. idea of arrangement, <hi rend="ital">to dispose, regulate, arrange, appoint, ordain, nominate, elect, choose</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">constituere et designare aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:38:82" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 38, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Anaxagoras primus omnium rerum descriptionem et modum mentis infinitae vi ac ratione designari et confici voluit,</quote> <trans><tr>to be designed and executed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 35</bibl>.—Esp., <hi rend="ital">to appoint to a public office</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem praetorem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Cal. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mamertinum Consulem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 12, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ii decemviratum habeant, quos plebs designaverit: oblitus est, nullos ab plebe designari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Catilina in proximum annum consulatum petebat, sperans si designatus foret, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 26</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n13382.8" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="dom">Polit. t. t.</usg>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēsig-nātus</orth>, <hi rend="ital">elect;</hi> applied to a person elected to an office, but who has not yet entered upon it: <cit><quote lang="la">consul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:58" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 58</bibl>, and the superscriptions of letters in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 4</bibl>-8: <cit><quote lang="la">tribunus plebis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 5, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 3, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 27:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 27, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:111:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 111, 3</bibl></cit> et saep.—Also, said of the office itself: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompeio consulatus designatus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:7:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 7, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13382.9" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">expected;</hi> of a child not yet born: <cit><quote lang="la">designatus civis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:11:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 11, 32</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
desilaus: <entryFree id="n13383" type="main" key="De^si^la_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĕsĭlāüs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*desi/laos</foreign>, <sense id="n13383.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Grecian painter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 75</bibl> (dub. Jan. Ctesilaus).</sense></entryFree>
desilio: <entryFree id="n13384" type="main" key="de_si^li^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-sĭlĭo</orth>, <itype>ĭlŭi</itype> (desului, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:prol. 75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. prol. 75</bibl>: <sense id="n13384.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">desilivi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:24:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 24, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">desilii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:5:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 5, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:12:3 al" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 12, 3 al.</bibl>), <itype>ultum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>salio</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to leap down</hi>. </sense><sense id="n13384.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. (class.). Constr. with <case>abl.</case> of the place whence, after <hi rend="ital">de, ex</hi>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in later prose with <hi rend="ital">ab</hi> or <hi rend="ital">without a prep.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de navi in scapham,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:prol. 75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. prol. 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de navibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 24, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de reda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:10:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 10, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de muro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in terram e scapha,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex navi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:25:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 25, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex essedis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex equis,</quote> <trans><tr>to dismount, alight</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which ab equo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:500" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 500</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">praeceps ab alto curru,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 129</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">with e curru,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:560" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 560</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curru,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:355" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 355</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so bijugis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 453</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altis turribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 17, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:378" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 378</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:6:14" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 6, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:5:26" default="NO">6, 5, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:15:3:13" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 15, 3, 13</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 25</bibl>.—Merely designating the terminus ad quem, with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in undas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:681" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 681</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in medias undas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:111" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aquas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:588" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 588</bibl></cit>: in <pb n="558" /> <cb n="DESI" /> latices, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:353" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 4, 353</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:64" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in rogos medios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in mortem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 76:22" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 76, 22</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad pedes,</quote> <trans><tr>to dismount</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad calciandas mulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 23</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">desilite commilitones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:25:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 25, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:722 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 722 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n13384.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> of inanimate subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">levis crepante lympha desilit pede,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:48" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 16, 48</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:13:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Od. 3, 13, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:428" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 428</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulminaque aetheria desiluisse domo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:16:50" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 16, 50</bibl></cit> (3, 8, 50 M.).—* </sense><sense id="n13384.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec desilies imitator in artum, unde, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>throw thyself into difficulties</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 134</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
